member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Advanced.AotCompilerTools
member.summary: Unlike traditional Mono/.NET, code on the iPhone is statically compiled ahead of time instead of being compiled on demand by a JIT compiler. This means there are a few limitations with respect to generics, these are caused because not every possible generic instantiation can be determined up front at compile time. The Aot Compiler is designed to overcome the limitations of this compiler. None of the methods in this class should ever be called, the code only has to exist at compile-time to be picked up by the AoT compiler. (Very similar to the LinkerIncludes.cs technique used in Xamarin.Android projects.)

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Advanced.AotCompilerTools.SeedPixelFormats
member.summary: This is the method that seeds the AoT compiler. None of these seed methods needs to actually be called to seed the compiler. The calls just need to be present when the code is compiled, and each implementation will be built.
member.remarks: This method doesn't actually do anything but serves an important purpose... If you are running ImageSharp on iOS and try to call SaveAsGif, it will throw an exception: "Attempting to JIT compile method... OctreeFrameQuantizer.ConstructPalette... while running in aot-only mode." The reason this happens is the SaveAsGif method makes heavy use of generics, which are too confusing for the AoT compiler used on Xamarin.iOS. It spins up the JIT compiler to try and figure it out, but that is an illegal op on iOS so it bombs out. If you are getting the above error, you need to call this method, which will pre-seed the AoT compiler with the necessary methods to complete the SaveAsGif call. That's it, otherwise you should NEVER need this method!!!

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Advanced.ParallelExecutionSettings.MinimumPixelsProcessedPerTask
member.summary: Gets the minimum number of pixels being processed by a single task when parallelizing operations with TPL. Launching tasks for pixel regions below this limit is not worth the overhead. Initialized with by default, the optimum value is operation specific. (The cheaper the operation, the larger the value is.)

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Advanced.PreserveAttribute
member.summary: This is necessary to avoid being excluded from compilation in environments that do AOT builds, such as Unity's IL2CPP and Xamarin. The only thing that matters is the class name. There is no need to use or inherit from the PreserveAttribute class in each environment.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Color
member.content: Contains constructors and implicit conversion methods.
member.summary: Represents a color value that is convertible to any type.
member.remarks: The internal representation and layout of this structure is hidden by intention. It's not serializable, and it should not be considered as part of a contract. Unlike System.Drawing.Color, has to be converted to a specific pixel value to query the color components.
member.content: Contains static named color values.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Color.WebSafePalette
member.summary: Gets a collection of named, web safe colors as defined in the CSS Color Module Level 4.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Color.WernerPalette
member.summary: Gets a collection of colors as defined in the original second edition of Werner’s Nomenclature of Colours 1821. The hex codes were collected and defined by Nicholas Rougeux .

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.CieLab
member.summary: Represents a CIE L*a*b* 1976 color.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.CieLab.DefaultWhitePoint
member.summary: D50 standard illuminant. Used when reference white is not specified explicitly.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.CieLab.L
member.summary: Gets the lightness dimension. A value usually ranging between 0 (black), 100 (diffuse white) or higher (specular white).

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.CieLab.A
member.summary: Gets the a color component. A value usually ranging from -100 to 100. Negative is green, positive magenta.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.CieLab.B
member.summary: Gets the b color component. A value usually ranging from -100 to 100. Negative is blue, positive is yellow

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.CieLab.WhitePoint
member.summary: Gets the reference white point of this color

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct.
member.remarks: Uses as white point.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct.

member.remarks: Uses as white point.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.Conversion.ColorSpaceConverterOptions.WhitePoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the white point used for chromatic adaptation in conversions from/to XYZ color space. When default, no adaptation will be performed. Defaults to: .

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.Conversion.ColorSpaceConverterOptions.TargetLuvWhitePoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the white point used *when creating* Luv/LChuv colors. (Luv/LChuv colors on the input already contain the white point information) Defaults to: .

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.Conversion.ColorSpaceConverterOptions.TargetLabWhitePoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the white point used *when creating* Lab/LChab colors. (Lab/LChab colors on the input already contain the white point information) Defaults to: .

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.Conversion.ColorSpaceConverterOptions.TargetHunterLabWhitePoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the white point used *when creating* HunterLab colors. (HunterLab colors on the input already contain the white point information) Defaults to: .

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.Conversion.ColorSpaceConverterOptions.TargetRgbWorkingSpace
member.summary: Gets or sets the target working space used *when creating* RGB colors. (RGB colors on the input already contain the working space information) Defaults to: .

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.Conversion.ColorSpaceConverterOptions.ChromaticAdaptation
member.summary: Gets or sets the chromatic adaptation method used. When null, no adaptation will be performed.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.Conversion.ColorSpaceConverterOptions.LmsAdaptationMatrix
member.summary: Gets or sets transformation matrix used in conversion to and from .

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.Conversion.IChromaticAdaptation
member.summary: Chromatic adaptation. A linear transformation of a source color (XS, YS, ZS) into a destination color (XD, YD, ZD) by a linear transformation [M] which is dependent on the source reference white (XWS, YWS, ZWS) and the destination reference white (XWD, YWD, ZWD).

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.Conversion.IChromaticAdaptation.Transform(SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.CieXyz@,SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.CieXyz@,SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.CieXyz@)
member.summary: Performs a linear transformation of a source color in to the destination color.
member.remarks: Doesn't crop the resulting color space coordinates (e. g. allows negative values for XYZ coordinates).

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.Conversion.IChromaticAdaptation.Transform(System.ReadOnlySpan{SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.CieXyz},System.Span{SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.CieXyz},SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.CieXyz,SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.CieXyz@)
member.summary: Performs a bulk linear transformation of a source color in to the destination color.
member.remarks: Doesn't crop the resulting color space coordinates (e. g. allows negative values for XYZ coordinates).
member.param: The span to the source colors.
The span to the destination colors.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.Conversion.LmsAdaptationMatrix
member.summary: Matrices used for transformation from to , defining the cone response domain. Used in
member.remarks: Matrix data obtained from: Two New von Kries Based Chromatic Adaptation Transforms Found by Numerical Optimization S. Bianco, R. member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Numerics.Log2SoftwareFallback(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Calculates floored log of the specified value, base 2. Note that by convention, input value 0 returns 0 since Log(0) is undefined. Bit hacking with deBruijn sequence, extremely fast yet does not use any intrinsics so will work on every platform/runtime.
member.remarks: Description of this bit hacking can be found here: https://cstheory.stackexchange.com/questions/19524/using-the-de-bruijn-sequence-to-find-the-lceil-log-2-v-rceil-of-an-integer

member.summary: SIMD optimized implementation for . Works only with span Length divisible by 8. Implementation adapted from: http://lolengine.net/blog/2011/3/20/understanding-fast-float-integer-conversions http://stackoverflow.com/a/536278

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.SimdUtils.BasicIntrinsics256.NormalizedFloatToByteSaturate(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Single},System.Span{System.Byte})
member.summary: Implementation of which is faster on older runtimes.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.SimdUtils.BasicIntrinsics256.BulkConvertNormalizedFloatToByte(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Single},System.Span{System.Byte})
member.summary:
Convert all values normalized into [0..1] from 'source' into 'dest' buffer of . The values are scaled up into [0-255] and rounded. This implementation is SIMD optimized and works only when span Length is divisible by 8. Based on:
http://lolengine.net/blog/2011/3/20/understanding-fast-float-integer-conversions

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.SimdUtils.HasVector8
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether code is being JIT-ed to AVX2 instructions where both float and integer registers are of size 256 byte.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.SimdUtils.HasVector4
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether code is being JIT-ed to SSE instructions where float and integer registers are of size 128 byte.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.SimdUtils.PseudoRound(System.Numerics.Vector4)
member.summary: Transform all scalars in 'v' in a way that converting them to would have rounding semantics.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.SimdUtils.FastRound(System.Numerics.Vector{System.Single})
member.summary:
Rounds all values in 'v' to the nearest integer following semantics. Source:
https://github.com/g-truc/glm/blob/master/glm/simd/common.h#L110

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.SimdUtils.ByteToNormalizedFloat(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte},System.Span{System.Single})
member.summary: Converts all input -s to -s normalized into [0..1]. should be the of the same size as , but there are no restrictions on the span's length.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.SimdUtils.NormalizedFloatToByteSaturate(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Single},System.Span{System.Byte})
member.summary: Convert all values normalized into [0..1] from 'source' into 'dest' buffer of . The values are scaled up into [0-255] and rounded, overflows are clamped. should be the of the same size as , but there are no restrictions on the span's length.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.SimdUtils.ExtendedIntrinsics
member.summary: Implementation methods based on newer API-s (Vector.Widen, Vector.Narrow, Vector.ConvertTo*). member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Compression.Zlib.Deflater
member.summary: This class compresses input with the deflate algorithm described in RFC 1951. It has several compression levels and three different strategies described below.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Compression.Zlib.Deflater.BestCompression
member.summary: The best and slowest compression level. This tries to find very long and distant string repetitions.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Compression.Zlib.Deflater.BestSpeed
member.summary: The worst but fastest compression level.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Compression.Zlib.Deflater.DefaultCompression
member.summary: The default compression level.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Compression.Zlib.Deflater.NoCompression
member.summary: This level won't compress at all but output uncompressed blocks.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Compression.Zlib.Deflater.Deflated
member.summary: The compression method. This is the only method supported so far. There is no need to use this constant at all.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Compression.Zlib.Deflater.level
member.summary: Compression level.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Compression.Zlib.Deflater.state
member.summary: The current state.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The memory allocator to use for buffer allocations.
The compression level, a value between NoCompression and BestCompression.
member.exception: if level is out of range.

member.summary: Compression Level as an enum for safer use

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Compression.Zlib.Deflater.CompressionLevel.BestCompression
member.summary: The best and slowest compression level. This tries to find very long and distant string repetitions.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Compression.Zlib.Deflater.CompressionLevel.BestSpeed
member.summary: The worst but fastest compression level.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Compression.Zlib.Deflater.CompressionLevel.DefaultCompression
member.summary: The default compression level.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Compression.Zlib.Deflater.CompressionLevel.NoCompression
member.summary: This level won't compress at all but output uncompressed blocks.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Compression.Zlib.Deflater.CompressionLevel.Deflated
member.summary: The compression method. This is the only method supported so far. There is no need to use this constant at all.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Compression.Zlib.Deflater.IsFinished
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whetherthe stream was finished and no more output bytes are available.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Compression.Zlib.Deflater.IsNeedingInput
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the input buffer is empty. You should then call setInput(). NOTE: This method can also return true when the stream was finished.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Compression.Zlib.Deflater.Reset
member.summary: Resets the deflater. The deflater acts afterwards as if it was just created with the same compression level and strategy as it had before.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Compression.Zlib.Deflater.Flush
member.summary: Flushes the current input block. Further calls to Deflate() will produce enough output to inflate everything in the current input block. It is used by DeflaterOutputStream to implement Flush().

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Compression.Zlib.Deflater.Finish
member.summary: Finishes the deflater with the current input block. It is an error to give more input after this method was called. This method must be called to force all bytes to be flushed.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Compression.Zlib.Deflater.SetInput(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the data which should be compressed next. This should be only called when needsInput indicates that more input is needed. The given byte array should not be changed, before needsInput() returns true again.
member.param: The buffer containing the input data.
The number of data bytes of input.
member.exception: if the buffer was finished or if previous input is still pending.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Compression.Zlib.Deflater.SetLevel(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the compression level. There is no guarantee of the exact position of the change, but if you call this when needsInput is true the change of compression level will occur somewhere near before the end of the so far given input.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Compression.Zlib.Deflater.Deflate(System.Span{System.Byte},System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Deflates the current input block to the given array.
member.param: Buffer to store the compressed data.
The maximum number of bytes that may be stored.
member.returns: The number of compressed bytes added to the output, or 0 if either or returns true or length is zero.

member.summary: Strategies for deflater

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Compression.Zlib.DeflateStrategy.Default
member.summary: The default strategy

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Compression.Zlib.DeflateStrategy.Filtered
member.summary: This strategy will only allow longer string repetitions. It is useful for random data with a small character set.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Compression.Zlib.DeflateStrategy.HuffmanOnly
member.summary: This strategy will not look for string repetitions at all. It only encodes with Huffman trees (which means, that more common characters get a smaller encoding.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Compression.Zlib.DeflaterEngine
member.summary: Low level compression engine for deflate algorithm which uses a 32K sliding window with secondary compression from Huffman/Shannon-Fano codes.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Compression.Zlib.DeflaterEngine.strstart
member.summary: Points to the current character in the window.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Compression.Zlib.DeflaterEngine.lookahead
member.summary: lookahead is the number of characters starting at strstart in window that are valid. So window[strstart] until window[strstart+lookahead-1] are valid characters.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Compression.Zlib.DeflaterEngine.compressionFunction
member.summary: The current compression function.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Compression.Zlib.DeflaterEngine.inputBuf
member.summary: The input data for compression.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Compression.Zlib.DeflaterEngine.inputOff
member.summary: The offset into inputBuf, where input data starts.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Compression.Zlib.DeflaterEngine.inputEnd
member.summary: The end offset of the input data.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Compression.Zlib.DeflaterEngine.headMemoryOwner
member.summary: Hashtable, hashing three characters to an index for window, so that window[index]..window[index+2] have this hash code. Note that the array should really be unsigned short, so you need to and the values with 0xFFFF.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Compression.Zlib.DeflaterEngine.prevMemoryOwner
member.summary: prev[index & WMASK] points to the previous index that has the same hash code as the string starting at index. This way entries with the same hash code are in a linked list. Note that the array should really be unsigned short, so you need to and the values with 0xFFFF.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Compression.Zlib.DeflaterEngine.windowMemoryOwner
member.summary: This array contains the part of the uncompressed stream that is of relevance. The current character is indexed by strstart.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Configuration.MemoryAllocator
member.summary:
Gets or sets the that is currently in use. Defaults to .
Allocators are expensive, so it is strongly recommended to use only one busy instance per process. In case you need to customize it, you can ensure this by changing
member.remarks:
It's possible to reduce allocator footprint by assigning a custom instance created with , but note that since the default pooling allocators are expensive, it is strictly recommended to use a single process-wide allocator. You can ensure this by altering the allocator of , or by implementing custom application logic that manages allocator lifetime.
If an allocator has to be dropped for some reason, shall be invoked after disposing all associated instances.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpCompression
member.summary: Defines the compression type of the image data in the bitmap file.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpCompression.RGB
member.summary: Each image row has a multiple of four elements. If the row has less elements, zeros will be added at the right side. The format depends on the number of bits, stored in the info header. If the number of bits are one, four or eight each pixel data is a index to the palette. If the number of bits are sixteen, twenty-four or thirty-two each pixel contains a color.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpCompression.RLE8
member.summary: Two bytes are one data record. If the first byte is not zero, the next byte will be repeated as much as the value of the first byte. If the first byte is zero, the record has different meanings, depending on the second byte. If the second byte is zero, it is the end of the row, if it is one, it is the end of the image.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpCompression.RLE4
member.summary: Two bytes are one data record. If the first byte is not zero, the next two half bytes will be repeated as much as the value of the first byte. If the first byte is zero, the record has different meanings, depending on the second byte. If the second byte is zero, it is the end of the row, if it is one, it is the end of the image.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpCompression.BitFields
member.summary: Each image row has a multiple of four elements. If the row has less elements, zeros will be added at the right side.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpCompression.JPEG
member.summary: The bitmap contains a JPG image. Not supported at the moment.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpCompression.PNG
member.summary: The bitmap contains a PNG image. Not supported at the moment.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpCompression.BI_ALPHABITFIELDS
member.summary: Introduced with Windows CE. Specifies that the bitmap is not compressed and that the color table consists of four DWORD color masks that specify the red, green, blue, and alpha components of each pixel.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpCompression.RLE24
member.summary:
OS/2 specific compression type. Similar to run length encoding of 4 and 8 bit. The only difference is that run values encoded are three bytes in size (one byte per RGB color component), rather than four or eight bits in size.
Note: Because compression value of 4 is ambiguous for BI_RGB for windows and RLE24 for OS/2, the enum value is remapped to a different value, to be clearly separate from valid windows values.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpDecoder
member.summary: Image decoder for generating an image out of a Windows bitmap stream.
member.remarks:
Does not support the following formats at the moment:
JPG
PNG
Some OS/2 specific subtypes like: Bitmap Array, Color Icon, Color Pointer, Icon, Pointer.
Formats will be supported in a later releases. We advise always to use only 24 Bit Windows bitmaps.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpDecoderCore.UncompressRle4(System.Int32,System.Span{System.Byte},System.Span{System.Boolean},System.Span{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Produce uncompressed bitmap data from a RLE4 stream.
member.remarks:
RLE4 is a 2-byte run-length encoding.
If first byte is 0, the second byte may have special meaning.
Otherwise, the first byte is the length of the run and second byte contains two color indexes.
member.param: Keeps track over skipped and therefore undefined pixels.
Keeps track of rows, which have undefined pixels.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpDecoderCore.UncompressRle8(System.Int32,System.Span{System.Byte},System.Span{System.Boolean},System.Span{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Produce uncompressed bitmap data from a RLE8 stream.
member.remarks:
RLE8 is a 2-byte run-length encoding.
If first byte is 0, the second byte may have special meaning.
Otherwise, the first byte is the length of the run and second byte is the color for the run.
member.param: Keeps track of skipped and therefore undefined pixels.
Keeps track of rows, which have undefined pixels.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpDecoderCore.UncompressRle24(System.Int32,System.Span{System.Byte},System.Span{System.Boolean},System.Span{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Produce uncompressed bitmap data from a RLE24 stream.
member.remarks:
If first byte is 0, the second byte may have special meaning.
Otherwise, the first byte is the length of the run and following three bytes are the color for the run.
member.param: Keeps track of skipped and therefore undefined pixels.
Keeps track of rows, which have undefined pixels.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the encoder should support transparency. Note: Transparency support only works together with 32 bits per pixel. This option will change the default behavior of the encoder of writing a bitmap version 3 info header with no compression. Instead a bitmap version 4 info header will be written with the BITFIELDS compression.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpFileHeader
member.summary: Stores general information about the Bitmap file.
member.remarks: The first two bytes of the Bitmap file format (thus the Bitmap header) are stored in big-endian order. All of the other integer values are stored in little-endian format (i.e. least-significant byte first).

member.summary: Parses a short variant of the OS22XBITMAPHEADER. It is identical to the BITMAPCOREHEADER, except that the width and height are 4 bytes instead of 2, resulting in 16 bytes total.

member.summary: Special case of the BITMAPINFOHEADER V3 used by adobe where the color bitmasks are part of the info header instead of following it. 52 bytes without the alpha mask, 56 bytes with the alpha mask.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpInfoHeader.ParseOs2Version2(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte})
member.summary: Parses a OS/2 version 2 bitmap header (64 bytes). Only the first 40 bytes are parsed which are very similar to the Bitmap v3 header. The other 24 bytes are ignored, but they do not hold any useful information for decoding the image.

member.summary: Parses the full BMP Version 4 BITMAPINFOHEADER header (108 bytes).

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Gif.LzwEncoder
member.summary: Encodes and compresses the image data using dynamic Lempel-Ziv compression.
member.remarks:
Adapted from Jef Poskanzer's Java port by way of J. M. G. Elliott. K Weiner 12/00
GIFCOMPR.C - GIF Image compression routines
Lempel-Ziv compression based on 'compress'. GIF modifications by David Rowley (mgardi@watdcsu.waterloo.edu)
GIF Image compression - modified 'compress'
Based on: compress.c - File compression ala IEEE Computer, June 1984. By Authors: Spencer W. Thomas (decvax!harpo!utah-cs!utah-gr!thomas) Jim McKie (decvax!mcvax!jim) Steve Davies (decvax!vax135!petsd!peora!srd) Ken Turkowski (decvax!decwrl!turtlevax!ken) James A. Woods (decvax!ihnp4!ames!jaw) Joe Orost (decvax!vax135!petsd!joe)

member.summary: 80% occupancy

member.summary: Should NEVER generate this code.

member.summary: The initial code size.

member.summary: Number of bits/code

member.summary: maximum code, given bitCount

member.summary: First unused entry

member.summary: Block compression parameters -- after all codes are used up, and compression rate changes, start over.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Gif.LzwEncoder.globalInitialBits
member.summary: Algorithm: use open addressing double hashing (no chaining) on the prefix code / next character combination. We do a variant of Knuth's algorithm D (vol. 3, sec. 6.4) along with G. Knott's relatively-prime secondary probe. Here, the modular division first probe is gives way to a faster exclusive-or manipulation. Also do block compression with an adaptive reset, whereby the code table is cleared when the compression ratio decreases, but after the table fills. The variable-length output codes are re-sized at this point, and a special CLEAR code is generated for the decompressor. Late addition: construct the table according to file size for noticeable speed improvement on small files. Please direct questions about this implementation to ames!jaw.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Gif.LzwEncoder.clearCode
member.summary: The clear code.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Gif.LzwEncoder.eofCode
member.summary: The end-of-file code.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Gif.LzwEncoder.currentAccumulator
member.summary: Output the given code. Inputs: code: A bitCount-bit integer. If == -1, then EOF. This assumes that bitCount =< wordsize - 1. Outputs: Outputs code to the file. Assumptions: Chars are 8 bits long. Algorithm: Maintain a BITS character long buffer (so that 8 codes will fit in it exactly). Use the VAX insv instruction to insert each code in turn. When the buffer fills up empty it and start over.

member.summary: Derived from the DHT marker. Contains the symbols, in order of incremental code length.

member.summary: Contains the largest code of length k (0 if none). MaxCode[17] is a sentinel to ensure terminates.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.Components.Decoder.HuffmanTable.ValOffset
member.summary: Values[] offset for codes of length k ValOffset[k] = Values[] index of 1st symbol of code length k, less the smallest code of length k; so given a code of length k, the corresponding symbol is Values[code + ValOffset[k]].

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.Components.Decoder.HuffmanTable.LookaheadSize
member.summary: Contains the length of bits for the given k value.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.Components.Decoder.HuffmanTable.LookaheadValue
member.summary:
Lookahead table: indexed by the next bits of the input data stream. If the next Huffman code is no more than bits long, we can obtain its length and the corresponding symbol directly from this tables.
The lower 8 bits of each table entry contain the number of bits in the corresponding Huffman code, or + 1 if too long. The next 8 bits of each entry contain the symbol.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.Components.Encoder.HuffmanLut
member.summary: A compiled look-up table representation of a huffmanSpec. The maximum codeword size is 16 bits.

remarks.para: Each value maps to a int32 of which the 24 most significant bits hold the codeword in bits and the 8 least significant bits hold the codeword size.

Code value occupies 24 most significant bits as integer value. This value is shifted to the MSB position for performance reasons. For example, decimal value 10 is stored like this:
MSB LSB 1010 0000 00000000 00000000 | 00000100
This was done to eliminate extra binary shifts in the encoder. While code length is represented as 8 bit integer value

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.Components.Encoder.HuffmanLut.TheHuffmanLut
member.summary: The compiled representations of theHuffmanSpec.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.Components.Encoder.HuffmanLut.#cctor
member.summary: Initializes static members of the struct.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.Components.Encoder.HuffmanLut.#ctor(SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.Components.Encoder.HuffmanSpec)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.Components.Encoder.HuffmanLut.Values
member.summary: Gets the collection of huffman values.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.Components.Encoder.HuffmanScanEncoder.MaxBytesPerBlock
member.summary: Maximum number of bytes encoded jpeg 8x8 block can occupy. It's highly unlikely for block to occupy this much space - it's a theoretical limit.
member.remarks: Where 16 is maximum huffman code binary length according to itu specs. 10 is maximum value binary length, value comes from discrete cosine tranform with value range: [-1024..1023]. Block stores 8x8 = 64 values thus multiplication by 64. Then divided by 8 to get the number of bytes. This value is then multiplied by for performance reasons.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.Components.Encoder.HuffmanScanEncoder.MaxBytesPerBlockMultiplier
member.summary: Multiplier used within cache buffers size calculation.

remarks.para: Theoretically, bytes buffer can fit exactly one minimal coding unit. In reality, coding blocks occupy much less space than the theoretical maximum - this can be exploited. If temporal buffer size is multiplied by at least 2, second half of the resulting buffer will be used as an overflow 'guard' if next block would occupy maximum number of bytes. While first half may fit many blocks before needing to flush.
This is subject to change. This can be equal to 1 but recomended value is 2 or even greater - futher benchmarking needed.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.Components.Encoder.HuffmanScanEncoder.OutputBufferLengthMultiplier
member.summary: size multiplier.
member.remarks: Jpeg specification requiers to insert 'stuff' bytes after each 0xff byte value. Worst case scenarion is when all bytes are 0xff. While it's highly unlikely (if not impossible) to get such combination, it's theoretically possible so buffer size must be guarded.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.Components.Encoder.HuffmanScanEncoder.huffmanTables
member.summary: Compiled huffman tree to encode given values.
member.remarks: Yields codewords by index consisting of [run length | bitsize].

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.Components.Encoder.HuffmanScanEncoder.accumulatedBits
member.summary: Emitted bits 'micro buffer' before being transferred to the .

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.Components.Encoder.HuffmanScanEncoder.emitBuffer
member.summary: Buffer for temporal storage of huffman rle encoding bit data.
member.remarks: Encoding bits are assembled to 4 byte unsigned integers and then copied to this buffer. This process does NOT include inserting stuff bytes.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.Components.Encoder.HuffmanScanEncoder.streamWriteBuffer
member.summary: Buffer for temporal storage which is then written to the output stream.
member.remarks: Encoding bits from are copied to this byte buffer including stuff bytes.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.Components.Encoder.HuffmanScanEncoder.bitCount

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.Components.Encoder.HuffmanScanEncoder.Emit(System.UInt32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Emits the most significant count of bits to the buffer.

remarks.para: Supports up to 32 count of bits but, generally speaking, jpeg standard assures that there won't be more than 16 bits per single value.

Emitting algorithm uses 3 intermediate buffers for caching before writing to the stream:
uint32
Bit buffer. Encoded spectral values can occupy up to 16 bits, bits are assembled to whole bytes via this intermediate buffer.
uint32[]
Assembled bytes from uint32 buffer are saved into this buffer. uint32 buffer values are saved using indices from the last to the first. As bytes are saved to the memory as 4-byte packages endianness matters: Jpeg stream is big-endian, indexing buffer bytes from the last index to the first eliminates all operations to extract separate bytes. This only works for little-endian machines (there are no known examples of big-endian users atm). For big-endians this approach is slower due to the separate byte extraction.
byte[]
Byte buffer used only during method.

member.param: Bits to emit, must be shifted to the left.
Bits count stored in the bits parameter.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.Components.FastFloatingPointDCT
member.summary: Contains inaccurate, but fast forward and inverse DCT implementations.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.Components.FastFloatingPointDCT.AdjustmentCoefficients
member.summary: Gets adjustment table for quantization tables.

remarks.para: Current IDCT and FDCT implementations are based on Arai, Agui, and Nakajima's algorithm. Both DCT methods does not produce finished DCT output, final step is fused into the quantization step. Quantization and de-quantization coefficients must be multiplied by these values.

Given values were generated by formula:
scalefactor[row] * scalefactor[col], where scalefactor[0] = 1 scalefactor[k] = cos(k*PI/16) * sqrt(2) for k=1..7

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.Components.ZigZag.ZigZagOrder
member.summary: Gets span of zig-zag ordering indices.
member.remarks: When reading corrupted data, the Huffman decoders could attempt to reference an entry beyond the end of this array (if the decoded zero run length reaches past the end of the block). To prevent wild stores without adding an inner-loop test, we put some extra "63"s after the real entries. This will cause the extra coefficient to be stored in location 63 of the block, not somewhere random. The worst case would be a run-length of 15, which means we need 16 fake entries.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.Components.ZigZag.TransposingOrder
member.summary: Gets span of zig-zag with fused transpose step ordering indices.
member.remarks: When reading corrupted data, the Huffman decoders could attempt to reference an entry beyond the end of this array (if the decoded zero run length reaches past the end of the block). To prevent wild stores without adding an inner-loop test, we put some extra "63"s after the real entries. This will cause the extra coefficient to be stored in location 63 of the block, not somewhere random. The worst case would be a run-length of 15, which means we need 16 fake entries.

member.summary: Gets the color type, that will be used to encode the image.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.JpegColorType
member.summary: Provides enumeration of available JPEG color types.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.JpegColorType.YCbCrRatio420
member.summary: YCbCr (luminance, blue chroma, red chroma) color as defined in the ITU-T T.871 specification. Medium Quality - The horizontal sampling is halved and the Cb and Cr channels are only sampled on each alternate line.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.JpegColorType.YCbCrRatio444
member.summary: YCbCr (luminance, blue chroma, red chroma) color as defined in the ITU-T T.871 specification. High Quality - Each of the three Y'CbCr components have the same sample rate, thus there is no chroma subsampling.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.JpegColorType.YCbCrRatio422
member.summary:
YCbCr (luminance, blue chroma, red chroma) color as defined in the ITU-T T.871 specification. The two chroma components are sampled at half the horizontal sample rate of luma while vertically it has full resolution.
Note: Not supported by the encoder.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.JpegColorType.YCbCrRatio411
member.summary:
YCbCr (luminance, blue chroma, red chroma) color as defined in the ITU-T T.871 specification. In 4:1:1 chroma subsampling, the horizontal color resolution is quartered.
Note: Not supported by the encoder.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.JpegColorType.YCbCrRatio410
member.summary:
YCbCr (luminance, blue chroma, red chroma) color as defined in the ITU-T T.871 specification. This ratio uses half of the vertical and one-fourth the horizontal color resolutions.
Note: Not supported by the encoder.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.JpegColorType.Luminance
member.summary: Single channel, luminance.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.JpegColorType.Rgb
member.summary: The pixel data will be preserved as RGB without any sub sampling.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.JpegColorType.Cmyk
member.summary:
CMYK colorspace (cyan, magenta, yellow, and key black) intended for printing.
Note: Not supported by the encoder.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.JpegConstants.Markers.SOF0
member.summary:
Start of Frame (baseline DCT)
Indicates that this is a baseline DCT-based JPEG, and specifies the width, height, number of components, and component subsampling (e.g., 4:2:0).

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.JpegConstants.Markers.SOF1
member.summary:
Start Of Frame (Extended Sequential DCT)
Indicates that this is a progressive DCT-based JPEG, and specifies the width, height, number of components, and component subsampling (e.g., 4:2:0).

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.JpegConstants.Markers.SOF2
member.summary:
Start Of Frame (progressive DCT)
Indicates that this is a progressive DCT-based JPEG, and specifies the width, height, number of components, and component subsampling (e.g., 4:2:0).

member.summary: Start of Frame marker, differential, Huffman coding, Differential sequential DCT.

member.summary: Start of Frame marker, differential, Huffman coding, Differential progressive DCT.

member.summary: Start of Frame marker, differential lossless, Huffman coding.

member.summary: Start of Frame marker, non-differential, arithmetic coding, Lossless (sequential).

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.JpegConstants.Markers.SOF13
member.summary: Start of Frame marker, differential, arithmetic coding, Differential sequential DCT.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.JpegConstants.Markers.SOF14
member.summary: Start of Frame marker, differential, arithmetic coding, Differential progressive DCT.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.JpegConstants.Markers.SOF15
member.summary: Start of Frame marker, differential, arithmetic coding, Differential lossless (sequential).

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.JpegConstants.Markers.DHT
member.summary:
Define Huffman Table(s)
Specifies one or more Huffman tables.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.JpegConstants.Markers.DRI
member.summary:
Define Restart Interval
Specifies the interval between RSTn markers, in macroblocks.This marker is followed by two bytes indicating the fixed size so it can be treated like any other variable size segment.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.JpegConstants.Markers.SOS
member.summary:
Start of Scan
Begins a top-to-bottom scan of the image. In baseline DCT JPEG images, there is generally a single scan. Progressive DCT JPEG images usually contain multiple scans. This marker specifies which slice of data it will contain, and is immediately followed by entropy-coded data.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.JpegConstants.Markers.RST0
member.summary:
Define First Restart
Inserted every r macroblocks, where r is the restart interval set by a DRI marker. Not used if there was no DRI marker. The low three bits of the marker code cycle in value from 0 to 7.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.JpegConstants.Markers.RST7
member.summary:
Define Eigth Restart
Inserted every r macroblocks, where r is the restart interval set by a DRI marker. Not used if there was no DRI marker. The low three bits of the marker code cycle in value from 0 to 7.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Pbm.PbmEncoder
member.summary:
Image encoder for writing an image to a stream as PGM, PBM or PPM bitmap. These images are from the family of PNM images.
The PNM formats are a fairly simple image format. They share a plain text header, consisting of: signature, width, height and max_pixel_value only. The pixels follow thereafter and can be in plain text decimals separated by spaces, or binary encoded.
PBM Black and white images, with 1 representing black and 0 representing white.
PGM Grayscale images, scaling from 0 to max_pixel_value, 0 representing black and max_pixel_value representing white.
PPM Color images, with RGB pixels (in that order), with 0 representing black and 2 representing full color.
The specification of these images is found at .

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.Filters.FilterType
member.summary: Provides enumeration of the various PNG filter types.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.Filters.FilterType.None
member.summary: With the None filter, the scanline is transmitted unmodified; it is only necessary to insert a filter type byte before the data.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.Filters.FilterType.Sub
member.summary: The Sub filter transmits the difference between each byte and the value of the corresponding byte of the prior pixel.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.Filters.FilterType.Up
member.summary: The Up filter is just like the Sub filter except that the pixel immediately above the current pixel, rather than just to its left, is used as the predictor.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.Filters.FilterType.Average
member.summary: The Average filter uses the average of the two neighboring pixels (left and above) to predict the value of a pixel.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.Filters.FilterType.Paeth
member.summary: The Paeth filter computes a simple linear function of the three neighboring pixels (left, above, upper left), then chooses as predictor the neighboring pixel closest to the computed value. This technique is due to Alan W. Paeth

member.summary: Gets the filter method.

member.summary: Gets the compression level 1-9. Defaults to .

member.summary: Gets the threshold of characters in text metadata, when compression should be used.

member.summary: Gets the gamma value, that will be written the image.
member.value: The gamma value of the image.

member.summary: Gets the quantizer for reducing the color count.

member.summary: Gets the transparency threshold.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.IPngEncoderOptions.InterlaceMethod

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.IPngEncoderOptions.IgnoreMetadata
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the metadata should be ignored when the image is being encoded. When set to true, all ancillary chunks will be skipped.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.IPngEncoderOptions.ChunkFilter
member.summary: Gets the chunk filter method. This allows to filter ancillary chunks.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.IPngEncoderOptions.TransparentColorMode
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether fully transparent pixels that may contain R, G, B values which are not 0, should be converted to transparent black, which can yield in better compression in some cases.

member.summary: Provides enumeration for the available PNG bit depths.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngBitDepth.Bit1
member.summary: 1 bit per sample or per palette index (not per pixel).

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngBitDepth.Bit2
member.summary: 2 bits per sample or per palette index (not per pixel).

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngBitDepth.Bit4
member.summary: 4 bits per sample or per palette index (not per pixel).

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngBitDepth.Bit8
member.summary: 8 bits per sample or per palette index (not per pixel).

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngBitDepth.Bit16
member.summary: 16 bits per sample or per palette index (not per pixel).

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunk
member.summary: Stores header information about a chunk.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunk.Length
member.summary: Gets the length. An unsigned integer giving the number of bytes in the chunk's data field. The length counts only the data field, not itself, the chunk type code, or the CRC. Zero is a valid length

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunk.Type
member.summary: Gets the chunk type. The value is the equal to the UInt32BigEndian encoding of its 4 ASCII characters.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunk.Data
member.summary: Gets the data bytes appropriate to the chunk type, if any. This field can be of zero length or null.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunk.IsCritical
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the given chunk is critical to decoding

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkFilter
member.summary: Provides enumeration of available PNG optimization methods.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkFilter.None
member.summary: With the None filter, all chunks will be written.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkFilter.ExcludePhysicalChunk
member.summary: Excludes the physical dimension information chunk from encoding.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkFilter.ExcludeGammaChunk
member.summary: Excludes the gamma information chunk from encoding.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkFilter.ExcludeExifChunk
member.summary: Excludes the eXIf chunk from encoding.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkFilter.ExcludeTextChunks
member.summary: Excludes the tTXt, iTXt or zTXt chunk from encoding.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkFilter.ExcludeAll
member.summary: All ancillary chunks will be excluded.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkType
member.summary: Contains a list of chunk types.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.Data
member.summary: The IDAT chunk contains the actual image data. The image can contains more than one chunk of this type. All chunks together are the whole image.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.End
member.summary: This chunk must appear last. It marks the end of the PNG data stream. The chunk's data field is empty.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.Header
member.summary: The first chunk in a png file. Can only exists once. Contains common information like the width and the height of the image or the used compression method.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.Palette
member.summary: The PLTE chunk contains from 1 to 256 palette entries, each a three byte series in the RGB format.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.Exif
member.summary: The eXIf data chunk which contains the Exif profile.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.Gamma
member.summary: This chunk specifies the relationship between the image samples and the desired display output intensity.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.Physical
member.summary: The pHYs chunk specifies the intended pixel size or aspect ratio for display of the image.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.Text
member.summary: Textual information that the encoder wishes to record with the image can be stored in tEXt chunks. Each tEXt chunk contains a keyword and a text string.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.CompressedText
member.summary: Textual information that the encoder wishes to record with the image. The zTXt and tEXt chunks are semantically equivalent, but the zTXt chunk is recommended for storing large blocks of text. Each zTXt chunk contains a (uncompressed) keyword and a compressed text string.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.InternationalText
member.summary: The iTXt chunk contains International textual data. It contains a keyword, an optional language tag, an optional translated keyword and the actual text string, which can be compressed or uncompressed.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.Transparency
member.summary: The tRNS chunk specifies that the image uses simple transparency: either alpha values associated with palette entries (for indexed-color images) or a single transparent color (for grayscale and true color images).

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.Time
member.summary: The tIME chunk gives the time of the last image modification (not the time of initial image creation).

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.Background
member.summary: The bKGD chunk specifies a default background colour to present the image against. If there is any other preferred background, either user-specified or part of a larger page (as in a browser), the bKGD chunk should be ignored.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.EmbeddedColorProfile
member.summary: The iCCP chunk contains a embedded color profile. If the iCCP chunk is present, the image samples conform to the colour space represented by the embedded ICC profile as defined by the International Color Consortium.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.SignificantBits
member.summary: The sBIT chunk defines the original number of significant bits (which can be less than or equal to the sample depth). This allows PNG decoders to recover the original data losslessly even if the data had a sample depth not directly supported by PNG.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.StandardRgbColourSpace
member.summary: If the sRGB chunk is present, the image samples conform to the sRGB colour space [IEC 61966-2-1] and should be displayed using the specified rendering intent defined by the International Color Consortium.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.Histogram
member.summary: The hIST chunk gives the approximate usage frequency of each colour in the palette.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.SuggestedPalette
member.summary: The sPLT chunk contains the suggested palette.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.Chroma
member.summary: The cHRM chunk may be used to specify the 1931 CIE x,y chromaticities of the red, green, and blue display primaries used in the image, and the referenced white point.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.ProprietaryApple
member.summary: Malformed chunk named CgBI produced by apple, which is not conform to the specification. Related issue is here https://github.com/SixLabors/ImageSharp/issues/410

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngColorType
member.summary: Provides enumeration of available PNG color types.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngColorType.Grayscale
member.summary: Each pixel is a grayscale sample.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngColorType.Rgb
member.summary: Each pixel is an R,G,B triple.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngColorType.Palette
member.summary: Each pixel is a palette index; a PLTE chunk must appear.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngColorType.GrayscaleWithAlpha
member.summary: Each pixel is a grayscale sample, followed by an alpha sample.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngColorType.RgbWithAlpha
member.summary: Each pixel is an R,G,B triple, followed by an alpha sample.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngFilterMethod
member.summary: Provides enumeration of available PNG filter methods.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngFilterMethod.None
member.summary: With the None filter, the scanline is transmitted unmodified.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngFilterMethod.Sub
member.summary: The Sub filter transmits the difference between each byte and the value of the corresponding byte of the prior pixel.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngFilterMethod.Up
member.summary: The Up filter is just like the filter except that the pixel immediately above the current pixel, rather than just to its left, is used as the predictor.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngFilterMethod.Average
member.summary: The Average filter uses the average of the two neighboring pixels (left and above) to predict the value of a pixel.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngFilterMethod.Paeth
member.summary: The Paeth filter computes a simple linear function of the three neighboring pixels (left, above, upper left), then chooses as predictor the neighboring pixel closest to the computed value.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngFilterMethod.Adaptive
member.summary: Computes the output scanline using all five filters, and selects the filter that gives the smallest sum of absolute values of outputs. This method usually outperforms any single fixed filter choice.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngFormat
member.summary: Registers the image encoders, decoders and mime type detectors for the png format.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngFormat.Instance
member.summary: Gets the current instance.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngHeader
member.summary: Represents the png header chunk.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngHeader.Width
member.summary: Gets the dimension in x-direction of the image in pixels.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngHeader.Height
member.summary: Gets the dimension in y-direction of the image in pixels.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngHeader.BitDepth
member.summary: Gets the bit depth. Bit depth is a single-byte integer giving the number of bits per sample or per palette index (not per pixel). Valid values are 1, 2, 4, 8, and 16, although not all values are allowed for all color types.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngHeader.ColorType
member.summary: Gets the color type. Color type is a integer that describes the interpretation of the image data. Color type codes represent sums of the following values: 1 (palette used), 2 (color used), and 4 (alpha channel used).

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngHeader.CompressionMethod
member.summary: Gets the compression method. Indicates the method used to compress the image data. At present, only compression method 0 (deflate/inflate compression with a sliding window of at most 32768 bytes) is defined.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngHeader.FilterMethod
member.summary: Gets the preprocessing method. Indicates the preprocessing method applied to the image data before compression. At present, only filter method 0 (adaptive filtering with five basic filter types) is defined.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngHeader.InterlaceMethod
member.summary: Gets the transmission order. Indicates the transmission order of the image data. Two values are currently defined: 0 (no interlace) or 1 (Adam7 interlace).

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngHeader.Validate
member.summary: Validates the png header.
member.exception: Thrown if the image does pass validation.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngHeader.WriteTo(System.Span{System.Byte})
member.summary: Writes the header to the given buffer.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngHeader.Parse(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte})
member.summary: Parses the PngHeader from the given data buffer.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngImageFormatDetector
member.summary: Detects png file headers

member.summary: Provides enumeration of available PNG interlace modes.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngInterlaceMode.None
member.summary: Non interlaced

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngInterlaceMode.Adam7
member.summary: Adam 7 interlacing.

member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of text data stored within the iTXt, tEXt, and zTXt chunks. Used for conveying textual information associated with the image.

member.summary: Provides methods to allow the decoding of raw scanlines to image rows of different pixel formats. TODO: We should make this a stateful class or struct to reduce the number of arguments on methods (most are invariant).

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngTextData
member.summary: Stores text data contained in the iTXt, tEXt, and zTXt chunks. Used for conveying textual information associated with the image, like the name of the author, the copyright information, the date, where the image was created, or some other information.

member.summary: Gets the keyword of this which indicates the type of information represented by the text string as described in https://www.w3.org/TR/PNG/#11keywords.
member.example: Typical properties are the author, copyright information or other meta information.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngTextData.Value
member.summary: Gets the value of this .

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngTextData.LanguageTag
member.summary: Gets an optional language tag defined in https://www.w3.org/TR/PNG/#2-RFC-3066 indicates the human language used by the translated keyword and the text. If the first word is two or three letters long, it is an ISO language code https://www.w3.org/TR/PNG/#2-ISO-639.
member.example: Examples: cn, en-uk, no-bok, x-klingon, x-KlInGoN.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngTextData.TranslatedKeyword
member.summary: Gets an optional translated keyword, should contain a translation of the keyword into the language indicated by the language tag.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tga.TgaFileHeader
member.summary: This block of bytes tells the application detailed information about the targa image.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tga.TgaFileHeader.Size
member.summary: Defines the size of the data structure in the targa file.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tga.TgaFileHeader.IdLength
member.summary: Gets the id length. This field identifies the number of bytes contained in Field 6, the Image ID Field. The maximum number of characters is 255. A value of zero indicates that no Image ID field is included with the image.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tga.TgaFileHeader.ColorMapType
member.summary: Gets the color map type. This field indicates the type of color map (if any) included with the image. There are currently 2 defined values for this field: 0 - indicates that no color-map data is included with this image. 1 - indicates that a color-map is included with this image.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tga.TgaFileHeader.ImageType
member.summary: Gets the image type. The TGA File Format can be used to store Pseudo-Color, True-Color and Direct-Color images of various pixel depths.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tga.TgaFileHeader.CMapStart
member.summary: Gets the start of the color map. This field and its sub-fields describe the color map (if any) used for the image. If the Color Map Type field is set to zero, indicating that no color map exists, then these 5 bytes should be set to zero.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tga.TgaFileHeader.CMapLength
member.summary: Gets the total number of color map entries included.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tga.TgaFileHeader.CMapDepth
member.summary: Gets the number of bits per entry. Typically 15, 16, 24 or 32-bit values are used.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tga.TgaFileHeader.XOffset
member.summary: Gets the XOffset. These bytes specify the absolute horizontal coordinate for the lower left corner of the image as it is positioned on a display device having an origin at the lower left of the screen.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tga.TgaFileHeader.YOffset
member.summary: Gets the YOffset. These bytes specify the absolute vertical coordinate for the lower left corner of the image as it is positioned on a display device having an origin at the lower left of the screen.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tga.TgaFileHeader.Width
member.summary: Gets the width of the image in pixels.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tga.TgaFileHeader.Height
member.summary: Gets the height of the image in pixels.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tga.TgaFileHeader.PixelDepth
member.summary: Gets the number of bits per pixel. This number includes the Attribute or Alpha channel bits. Common values are 8, 16, 24 and 32 but other pixel depths could be used.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tga.TgaFileHeader.ImageDescriptor
member.summary: Gets the ImageDescriptor. ImageDescriptor contains two pieces of information. Bits 0 through 3 contain the number of attribute bits per pixel. Attribute bits are found only in pixels for the 16- and 32-bit flavors of the TGA format and are called alpha channel, overlay, or interrupt bits. Bits 4 and 5 contain the image origin location (coordinate 0,0) of the image. This position may be any of the four corners of the display screen. When both of these bits are set to zero, the image origin is the lower-left corner of the screen. Bits 6 and 7 of the ImageDescriptor field are unused and should be set to 0.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.Compression.Compressors.TiffLzwEncoder
member.summary: Encodes and compresses the image data using dynamic Lempel-Ziv compression.

remarks.para: This code is based on the used for GIF encoding. There is potential for a shared implementation. Differences between the GIF and TIFF implementations of the LZW encoding are: (i) The GIF implementation includes an initial 'data size' byte, whilst this is always 8 for TIFF. (ii) The GIF implementation writes a number of sub-blocks with an initial byte indicating the length of the sub-block. In TIFF the data is written as a single block with no length indicator (this can be determined from the 'StripByteCounts' entry).

member.summary: If set, uncompressed mode is used.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.Compression.FaxCompressionOptions.EolPadding
member.summary: If set, fill bits have been added as necessary before EOL codes such that EOL always ends on a byte boundary, thus ensuring an EOL-sequence of 1 byte preceded by a zero nibble: xxxx-0000 0000-0001.

member.summary: Inverts the horizontal prediction.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.Compression.HorizontalPredictor.ApplyHorizontalPrediction24Bit(System.Span{System.Byte},System.Int32)
member.summary: Applies a horizontal predictor to the rgb row. Make use of the fact that many continuous-tone images rarely vary much in pixel value from one pixel to the next. In such images, if we replace the pixel values by differences between consecutive pixels, many of the differences should be 0, plus or minus 1, and so on.This reduces the apparent information content and allows LZW to encode the data more compactly.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.Compression.HorizontalPredictor.ApplyHorizontalPrediction8Bit(System.Span{System.Byte},System.Int32)
member.summary: Applies a horizontal predictor to a gray pixel row.

Note: The TIFF encoder does not support this compression and will default to use no compression instead, if this is chosen.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.Constants.TiffCompression.Jpeg
member.summary:
JPEG compression (see TIFF Specification, supplement 2).
Note: The TIFF encoder does not yet support this compression and will default to use no compression instead, if this is chosen.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.Constants.TiffCompression.Deflate
member.summary: Deflate compression, using zlib data format (see TIFF Specification, supplement 2).

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.Constants.TiffCompression.ItuTRecT82
member.summary:
ITU-T Rec. T.82 coding, applying ITU-T Rec. T.85 (JBIG) (see RFC2301).
Note: The TIFF encoder does not yet support this compression and will default to use no compression instead, if this is chosen.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.Constants.TiffCompression.ItuTRecT43
member.summary:
ITU-T Rec. T.43 representation, using ITU-T Rec. T.82 (JBIG) (see RFC2301).
Note: The TIFF encoder does not yet support this compression and will default to use no compression instead, if this is chosen.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.Constants.TiffCompression.NeXT
member.summary:
NeXT 2-bit Grey Scale compression algorithm.
Note: The TIFF encoder does not support this compression and will default to use no compression instead, if this is chosen.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.Constants.TiffCompression.PackBits
member.summary: PackBits compression.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.Constants.TiffCompression.ThunderScan
member.summary:
ThunderScan 4-bit compression.
Note: The TIFF encoder does not support this compression and will default to use no compression instead, if this is chosen.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.Constants.TiffCompression.OldDeflate
member.summary:
Deflate compression - old.
Note: The TIFF encoder does not support this compression and will default to use no compression instead, if this is chosen.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.Constants.TiffPhotometricInterpretation.WhiteIsZero
member.summary:
Bilevel and grayscale: 0 is imaged as white. The maximum value is imaged as black.
Not supported by the TiffEncoder.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.Constants.TiffPhotometricInterpretation.BlackIsZero
member.summary: Bilevel and grayscale: 0 is imaged as black. The maximum value is imaged as white.

member.summary: RGB image.

member.summary:
A transparency mask.
Not supported by the TiffEncoder.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.Constants.TiffPhotometricInterpretation.Separated
member.summary:
Separated: usually CMYK (see Section 16 of the TIFF 6.0 specification).
Not supported by the TiffEncoder.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.Constants.TiffPhotometricInterpretation.YCbCr
member.summary:
YCbCr (see Section 21 of the TIFF 6.0 specification).
Not supported by the TiffEncoder.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.Constants.TiffPhotometricInterpretation.CieLab
member.summary:
1976 CIE L*a*b* (see Section 23 of the TIFF 6.0 specification).
Not supported by the TiffEncoder.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.Constants.TiffPhotometricInterpretation.IccLab
member.summary:
ICC L*a*b* (see TIFF Specification, supplement 1).
Not supported by the TiffEncoder.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.Constants.TiffPhotometricInterpretation.ItuLab
member.summary:
ITU L*a*b* (see RFC2301).
Not supported by the TiffEncoder.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.Constants.TiffPhotometricInterpretation.ColorFilterArray
member.summary:
Color Filter Array (see the DNG specification).
Not supported by the TiffEncoder.

member.summary:
Linear Raw (see the DNG specification).
Not supported by the TiffEncoder.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.Constants.TiffPlanarConfiguration
member.summary: Enumeration representing how the components of each pixel are stored the Tiff file-format.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.Constants.TiffPlanarConfiguration.Chunky
member.summary: Chunky format. The component values for each pixel are stored contiguously. The order of the components within the pixel is specified by PhotometricInterpretation. For example, for RGB data, the data is stored as RGBRGBRGB.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.Constants.TiffPlanarConfiguration.Planar
member.summary: Planar format. The components are stored in separate “component planes.” The values in StripOffsets and StripByteCounts are then arranged as a 2-dimensional array, with SamplesPerPixel rows and StripsPerImage columns. (All of the columns for row 0 are stored first, followed by the columns of row 1, and so on.) PhotometricInterpretation describes the type of data stored in each component plane. For example, RGB data is stored with the Red components in one component plane, the Green in another, and the Blue in another.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.Constants.TiffPredictor
member.summary: A mathematical operator that is applied to the image data before an encoding scheme is applied.

member.summary: No prediction.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.Constants.TiffPredictor.Horizontal
member.summary: Horizontal differencing.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.Constants.TiffPredictor.FloatingPoint
member.summary:
Floating point horizontal differencing.
Note: The Tiff Encoder does not yet support this. If this is chosen, the encoder will fallback to none.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.TiffBitsPerPixel
member.summary: Enumerates the available bits per pixel for the tiff format.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.TiffBitsPerPixel.Bit1
member.summary: 1 bit per pixel, for bi-color image.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.TiffBitsPerPixel.Bit4
member.summary: 4 bits per pixel, for images with a color palette.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.TiffBitsPerPixel.Bit6
member.summary:
6 bits per pixel. 2 bit for each color channel.
Note: The TiffEncoder does not yet support 2 bits per color channel and will default to 24 bits per pixel instead.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.TiffBitsPerPixel.Bit8
member.summary: 8 bits per pixel, grayscale or color palette images.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.TiffBitsPerPixel.Bit10
member.summary:
10 bits per pixel, for gray images.
Note: The TiffEncoder does not yet support 10 bits per pixel and will default to 24 bits per pixel instead.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.TiffBitsPerPixel.Bit12
member.summary:
12 bits per pixel. 4 bit for each color channel.
Note: The TiffEncoder does not yet support 4 bits per color channel and will default to 24 bits per pixel instead.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.TiffBitsPerPixel.Bit14
member.summary:
14 bits per pixel, for gray images.
Note: The TiffEncoder does not yet support 14 bits per pixel images and will default to 24 bits per pixel instead.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.TiffBitsPerPixel.Bit16
member.summary:
16 bits per pixel, for gray images.
Note: The TiffEncoder does not yet support 16 bits per color channel and will default to 24 bits per pixel instead.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.TiffBitsPerPixel.Bit24
member.summary: 24 bits per pixel. One byte for each color channel.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.TiffBitsPerPixel.Bit30
member.summary:
30 bits per pixel. 10 bit for each color channel.
Note: The TiffEncoder does not yet support 10 bits per color channel and will default to 24 bits per pixel instead.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.TiffBitsPerPixel.Bit36
member.summary:
36 bits per pixel. 12 bit for each color channel.
Note: The TiffEncoder does not yet support 12 bits per color channel and will default to 24 bits per pixel instead.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.TiffBitsPerPixel.Bit42
member.summary:
42 bits per pixel. 14 bit for each color channel.
Note: The TiffEncoder does not yet support 14 bits per color channel and will default to 24 bits per pixel instead.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Tiff.TiffBitsPerPixel.Bit48
member.summary:
48 bits per pixel. 16 bit for each color channel.
Note: The TiffEncoder does not yet support 16 bits per color channel and will default to 24 bits per pixel instead.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.IWebpEncoderOptions
member.summary: Configuration options for use during webp encoding.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.IWebpEncoderOptions.FileFormat
member.summary: Gets the webp file format used. Either lossless or lossy. Defaults to lossy.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.IWebpEncoderOptions.Quality
member.summary: Gets the compression quality. Between 0 and 100. For lossy, 0 gives the smallest size and 100 the largest. For lossless, this parameter is the amount of effort put into the compression: 0 is the fastest but gives larger files compared to the slowest, but best, 100. Defaults to 75.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.IWebpEncoderOptions.Method
member.summary: Gets the encoding method to use. Its a quality/speed trade-off (0=fast, 6=slower-better). Defaults to 4.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.IWebpEncoderOptions.UseAlphaCompression
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the alpha plane should be compressed with Webp lossless format. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.IWebpEncoderOptions.EntropyPasses
member.summary: Gets the number of entropy-analysis passes (in [1..10]). Defaults to 1.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.IWebpEncoderOptions.SpatialNoiseShaping
member.summary: Gets the amplitude of the spatial noise shaping. Spatial noise shaping (or sns for short) refers to a general collection of built-in algorithms used to decide which area of the picture should use relatively less bits, and where else to better transfer these bits. The possible range goes from 0 (algorithm is off) to 100 (the maximal effect). Defaults to 50.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.IWebpEncoderOptions.FilterStrength
member.summary: Gets the strength of the deblocking filter, between 0 (no filtering) and 100 (maximum filtering). A value of 0 will turn off any filtering. Higher value will increase the strength of the filtering process applied after decoding the picture. The higher the value the smoother the picture will appear. Typical values are usually in the range of 20 to 50. Defaults to 60.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.IWebpEncoderOptions.TransparentColorMode
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether to preserve the exact RGB values under transparent area. Otherwise, discard this invisible RGB information for better compression. The default value is Clear.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.IWebpEncoderOptions.NearLossless
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether near lossless mode should be used. This option adjusts pixel values to help compressibility, but has minimal impact on the visual quality.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.IWebpEncoderOptions.NearLosslessQuality
member.summary: Gets the quality of near-lossless image preprocessing. The range is 0 (maximum preprocessing) to 100 (no preprocessing, the default). The typical value is around 60. Note that lossy with -q 100 can at times yield better results.

member.summary: Maximum bit length.

member.summary: We want the max value to be attainable and stored in MaxLengthBits bits.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.Lossless.BackwardReferenceEncoder.MinLength
member.summary: Minimum number of pixels for which it is cheaper to encode a distance + length instead of each pixel as a literal.

Evaluates best possible backward references for specified quality. The input cacheBits to 'GetBackwardReferences' sets the maximum cache bits to use (passing 0 implies disabling the local color cache). The optimal cache bits is evaluated and set for the cacheBits parameter. The return value is the pointer to the best of the two backward refs viz, refs[0] or refs[1].

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.Lossless.BackwardReferenceEncoder.CalculateBestCacheSize(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.UInt32},System.Int32,SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.Lossless.Vp8LBackwardRefs,System.Int32)
member.summary: Evaluate optimal cache bits for the local color cache. The input bestCacheBits sets the maximum cache bits to use (passing 0 implies disabling the local color cache). The local color cache is also disabled for the lower (smaller then 25) quality.
Compute an LZ77 by forcing matches to happen within a given distance cost. We therefore limit the algorithm to the lowest 32 values in the PlaneCode definition.

member.summary: Update (in-place) backward references for the specified cacheBits.
