member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.Lossless.CostCacheInterval
member.summary: The GetLengthCost(costModel, k) are cached in a CostCacheInterval.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.Lossless.CostInterval
member.summary: To perform backward reference every pixel at index index_ is considered and the cost for the MAX_LENGTH following pixels computed. Those following pixels at index index_ + k (k from 0 to MAX_LENGTH) have a cost of: cost = distance cost at index + GetLengthCost(costModel, k) and the minimum value is kept. GetLengthCost(costModel, k) is cached in an array of size MAX_LENGTH. Instead of performing MAX_LENGTH comparisons per pixel, we keep track of the minimal values using intervals of constant cost. An interval is defined by the index_ of the pixel that generated it and is only useful in a range of indices from start to end (exclusive), i.e. it contains the minimum value for pixels between start and end. Intervals are stored in a linked list and ordered by start. When a new interval has a better value, old intervals are split or removed. There are therefore no overlapping intervals.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.Lossless.CostManager
member.summary: The CostManager is in charge of managing intervals and costs. It caches the different CostCacheInterval, caches the different GetLengthCost(costModel, k) in costCache and the CostInterval's.

Includes special handling for the following cases: - IsTrivialLiteral: one common literal base for RED/BLUE/ALPHA (not GREEN) - IsTrivialCode: only 1 code (no bit is read from the bitstream) - UsePackedTable: few enough literal symbols, so all the bit codes can fit into a small look-up table PackedTable[] The common literal base, if applicable, is stored in 'LiteralArb'.

member.summary: Returns the exact index where array1 and array2 are different. For an index inferior or equal to bestLenMatch, the return value just has to be strictly inferior to bestLenMatch match. The current behavior is to return 0 if this index is bestLenMatch, and the index itself otherwise. If no two elements are the same, it returns maxLimit.

member.summary: If there are not many unique pixel values, it is more efficient to create a color index array and replace the pixel values by the array's indices. This will reverse the color index transform.
member.param: The transform data contains color table size and the entries in the color table.
The pixel data to apply the reverse transform on.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.Lossless.LosslessUtils.ColorSpaceInverseTransform(SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.Lossless.Vp8LTransform,System.Span{System.UInt32})
member.summary: The goal of the color transform is to de-correlate the R, G and B values of each pixel. Color transform keeps the green (G) value as it is, transforms red (R) based on green and transforms blue (B) based on green and then based on red.
member.param: The pixel data to apply the inverse transform on.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.Lossless.LosslessUtils.TransformColor(SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.Lossless.Vp8LMultipliers,System.Span{System.UInt32},System.Int32)
member.summary: Color transform keeps the green (G) value as it is, transforms red (R) based on green and transforms blue (B) based on green and then based on red.
member.param: The number of pixels to process.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.Lossless.LosslessUtils.TransformColorInverse(SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.Lossless.Vp8LMultipliers,System.Span{System.UInt32})
member.summary: Reverses the color space transform.
member.param: The pixel data to apply the inverse transform on.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.Lossless.LosslessUtils.PredictorInverseTransform(SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.Lossless.Vp8LTransform,System.Span{System.UInt32},System.Span{System.UInt32})
member.summary: This will reverse the predictor transform. The predictor transform can be used to reduce entropy by exploiting the fact that neighboring pixels are often correlated. In the predictor transform, the current pixel value is predicted from the pixels already decoded (in scan-line order) and only the residual value (actual - predicted) is encoded. The prediction mode determines the type of prediction to use. The image is divided into squares and all the pixels in a square use same prediction mode.
member.param: The pixel data to apply the inverse transform.
The resulting pixel data with the reversed transformation data.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.Lossless.NearLosslessEnc
member.summary: Near-lossless image preprocessing adjusts pixel values to help compressibility with a guarantee of maximum deviation between original and resulting pixel values.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.Lossless.PredictorEncoder
member.summary: Image transform methods for the lossless webp encoder.

Finds the best predictor for each tile, and converts the image to residuals with respect to predictions. If nearLosslessQuality < 100, applies near lossless processing, shaving off more bits of residuals for lower qualities.

Returns best predictor and updates the accumulated histogram. If maxQuantization > 1, assumes that near lossless processing will be applied, quantizing residuals to multiples of quantization levels up to maxQuantization (the actual quantization level depends on smoothness near the given pixel).

Stores the difference between the pixel and its prediction in "output". In case of a lossy encoding, updates the source image to avoid propagating the deviation further to pixels which depend on the current pixel for their predictions.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.Lossless.PredictorEncoder.NearLossless(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Quantize every component of the difference between the actual pixel value and its prediction to a multiple of a quantization (a power of 2, not larger than maxQuantization which is a power of 2, smaller than maxDiff). Take care if value and predict have undergone subtract green, which means that red and blue are represented as offsets from green.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.Lossless.PredictorEncoder.NearLosslessComponent(System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Int32)
member.summary: Quantize the difference between the actual component value and its prediction to a multiple of quantization, working modulo 256, taking care not to cross a boundary (inclusive upper limit).

Converts pixels of the image to residuals with respect to predictions. If max_quantization > 1, applies near lossless processing, quantizing residuals to multiples of quantization levels up to max_quantization (the actual quantization level depends on smoothness near the given pixel).

member.summary: The palette has been sorted by alpha. This function checks if the other components of the palette have a monotonic development with regards to position in the palette. If all have monotonic development, there is no benefit to re-organize them greedily. A monotonic development would be spotted in green-only situations (like lossy alpha) or gray-scale images.
member.param: Number of colors in the palette.
member.returns: True, if the palette has no monotonous deltas.

member.summary: Accumulate a token 'v' into a histogram.
member.param: Indicates whether to use the distance modifier.
xSize is only used when useDistanceModifier is true.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.Lossless.Vp8LHistogram.EstimateBits(SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.Lossless.Vp8LStreaks,SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.Lossless.Vp8LBitEntropy)
member.summary: Estimate how many bits the combined entropy of literals and distance approximately maps to.

Performs output = a + b, computing the cost C(a+b) - C(a) - C(b) while comparing to the threshold value 'costThreshold'. The score returned is Score = C(a+b) - C(a) - C(b), where C(a) + C(b) is known and fixed. Since the previous score passed is 'costThreshold', we only need to compare the partial cost against 'costThreshold + C(a) + C(b)' to possibly bail-out early.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.Lossless.Vp8LTransformType
member.summary: Enum for the different transform types. Transformations are reversible manipulations of the image data that can reduce the remaining symbolic entropy by modeling spatial and color correlations. Transformations can make the final compression more dense.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.Lossless.Vp8LTransformType.PredictorTransform
member.summary: The predictor transform can be used to reduce entropy by exploiting the fact that neighboring pixels are often correlated.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.Lossless.Vp8LTransformType.CrossColorTransform
member.summary: The goal of the color transform is to de-correlate the R, G and B values of each pixel. Color transform keeps the green (G) value as it is, transforms red (R) based on green and transforms blue (B) based on green and then based on red.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.Lossless.Vp8LTransformType.SubtractGreen
member.summary: The subtract green transform subtracts green values from red and blue values of each pixel. When this transform is present, the decoder needs to add the green value to both red and blue. There is no data associated with this transform.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.Lossless.Vp8LTransformType.ColorIndexingTransform
member.summary: If there are not many unique pixel values, it may be more efficient to create a color index array and replace the pixel values by the array's indices. The color indexing transform achieves this.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.Lossy.Vp8MacroBlockData.NonZeroY
member.summary: Gets or sets bit-wise info about the content of each sub-4x4 blocks (in decoding order). Each of the 4x4 blocks for y/u/v is associated with a 2b code according to: code=0 -> no coefficient code=1 -> only DC code=2 -> first three coefficients are non-zero code=3 -> more than three coefficients are non-zero This allows to call specialized transform functions.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.Lossy.Vp8MacroBlockData.NonZeroUv
member.summary: Gets or sets bit-wise info about the content of each sub-4x4 blocks (in decoding order). Each of the 4x4 blocks for y/u/v is associated with a 2b code according to: code=0 -> no coefficient code=1 -> only DC code=2 -> first three coefficients are non-zero code=3 -> more than three coefficients are non-zero This allows to call specialized transform functions.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.WebpConstants.FilterExtraRows
member.summary: How many extra lines are needed on the MB boundary for caching, given a filtering level. Simple filter(1): up to 2 luma samples are read and 1 is written. Complex filter(2): up to 4 luma samples are read and 3 are written. Same for U/V, so it's 8 samples total (because of the 2x upsampling).

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.WebpDecoderCore.ReadVp8XHeader
member.summary: Reads an the extended webp file header. An extended file header consists of: - A 'VP8X' chunk with information about features used in the file. - An optional 'ICCP' chunk with color profile. - An optional 'XMP' chunk with metadata. - An optional 'ANIM' chunk with animation control data. - An optional 'ALPH' chunk with alpha channel data. After the image header, image data will follow. After that optional image metadata chunks (EXIF and XMP) can follow.

member.summary: Reads the header of a lossless webp image.

member.summary: Parses optional VP8X chunks, which can be ICCP, XMP, ANIM or ALPH chunks.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.WebpDecoderCore.ParseOptionalChunks(SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Webp.WebpFeatures)
member.summary: Parses optional metadata chunks. There SHOULD be at most one chunk of each type ('EXIF' and 'XMP '). If there are more such chunks, readers MAY ignore all except the first one. Also, a file may possibly contain both 'EXIF' and 'XMP ' chunks.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Image.WrapMemory``1(SixLabors.ImageSharp.Configuration,System.Memory{``0},System.Int32,System.Int32,SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.ImageMetadata)

summary.para: Wraps an existing contiguous memory area of at least 'width' x 'height' pixels allowing viewing/manipulation as an instance.

Please note: using this method does not transfer the ownership of the underlying buffer of the input to the new instance. This means that consumers of this method must ensure that the input buffer is either self-contained, (for example, a instance wrapping a new array that was created), or that the owning object is not disposed until the returned is disposed.

If the input instance is one retrieved from an instance rented from a memory pool (such as ), and that owning instance is disposed while the image is still in use, this will lead to undefined behavior and possibly runtime crashes (as the same buffer might then be modified by other consumers while the returned image is still working on it). Make sure to control the lifetime of the input buffers appropriately.

member.param: The width of the memory image.
The height of the memory image.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Image.WrapMemory``1(SixLabors.ImageSharp.Configuration,System.Void*,System.Int32,System.Int32,SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.ImageMetadata)

summary.para: Wraps an existing contiguous memory area of at least 'width' x 'height' pixels allowing viewing/manipulation as an instance.

Please note: this method relies on callers to carefully manage the target memory area being referenced by the pointer and that the lifetime of such a memory area is at least equal to that of the returned instance. For example, if the input pointer references an unmanaged memory area, callers must ensure that the memory area is not freed as long as the returned is in use and not disposed. The same applies if the input memory area points to a pinned managed object, as callers must ensure that objects will remain pinned as long as the instance is in use. Failing to do so constitutes undefined behavior and will likely lead to memory corruption and runtime crashes.

Note also that if you have a or an array (which can be cast to ) of either or values, it is highly recommended to use one of the other available overloads of this method instead (such as or , to make the resulting code less error prone and avoid having to pin the underlying memory buffer in use. This method is primarily meant to be used when doing interop or working with buffers that are located in unmanaged memory.

member.param: The pointer to the target memory buffer to wrap.
The width of the memory image.
The height of the memory image.

member.summary: Returns a value-type implementing an allocation-free enumerator of the memory groups in the current instance. member.summary:
Gets or sets unit of measure used when reporting resolution.
Value Unit
AspectRatio (00) No units; width:height pixel aspect ratio = Ydensity:Xdensity
PixelsPerInch (01) Pixels per inch (2.54 cm)
PixelsPerCentimeter (02) Pixels per centimeter
PixelsPerMeter (03) Pixels per meter (100 cm)

member.summary: Specifies exif data types.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifDataType.Unknown
member.summary: Unknown

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifDataType.Byte
member.summary: An 8-bit unsigned integer.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifDataType.Ascii
member.summary:
An 8-bit byte containing one 7-bit ASCII code. The final byte is terminated with NULL.
Although the standard defines ASCII this has commonly been ignored as ASCII cannot properly encode text in many languages.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifDataType.Short
member.summary: A 16-bit (2-byte) unsigned integer.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifDataType.Long
member.summary: A 32-bit (4-byte) unsigned integer.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifDataType.Rational
member.summary: Two LONGs. The first LONG is the numerator and the second LONG expresses the denominator.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifDataType.SignedByte
member.summary: An 8-bit signed integer.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifDataType.Undefined
member.summary: An 8-bit byte that can take any value depending on the field definition.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifDataType.SignedShort
member.summary: A 16-bit (2-byte) signed integer.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifDataType.SignedLong
member.summary: A 32-bit (4-byte) signed integer (2's complement notation).

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifDataType.SignedRational
member.summary: Two SLONGs. The first SLONG is the numerator and the second SLONG is the denominator.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifDataType.SingleFloat
member.summary: A 32-bit single precision floating point value.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifDataType.DoubleFloat
member.summary: A 64-bit double precision floating point value.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifDataType.Ifd
member.summary: Reference to an IFD (32-bit (4-byte) unsigned integer).

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifDataType.Long8
member.summary: A 64-bit (8-byte) unsigned integer.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifDataType.SignedLong8
member.summary: A 64-bit (8-byte) signed integer (2's complement notation).

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifDataType.Ifd8
member.summary: Reference to an IFD (64-bit (8-byte) unsigned integer).

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifTagValue.SubfileType
member.summary: A general indication of the kind of data contained in this subfile. See Section 8: Baseline Fields.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifTagValue.OldSubfileType
member.summary: A general indication of the kind of data contained in this subfile. See Section 8: Baseline Fields.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifTagValue.ImageWidth
member.summary: The number of columns in the image, i.e., the number of pixels per row. See Section 8: Baseline Fields.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifTagValue.ImageLength
member.summary: The number of rows of pixels in the image. See Section 8: Baseline Fields.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifTagValue.BitsPerSample
member.summary: Number of bits per component. See Section 8: Baseline Fields.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifTagValue.Compression
member.summary: Compression scheme used on the image data. See Section 8: Baseline Fields.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifTagValue.PhotometricInterpretation
member.summary: The color space of the image data. See Section 8: Baseline Fields.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifTagValue.Thresholding
member.summary: For black and white TIFF files that represent shades of gray, the technique used to convert from gray to black and white pixels. See Section 8: Baseline Fields.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifTagValue.CellWidth
member.summary: The width of the dithering or halftoning matrix used to create a dithered or halftoned bilevel file. See Section 8: Baseline Fields.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifTagValue.CellLength
member.summary: The length of the dithering or halftoning matrix used to create a dithered or halftoned bilevel file. See Section 8: Baseline Fields.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifTagValue.FillOrder
member.summary: The logical order of bits within a byte. See Section 8: Baseline Fields.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifTagValue.DocumentName
member.summary: The name of the document from which this image was scanned. See Section 12: Document Storage and Retrieval.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifTagValue.ImageDescription
member.summary: A string that describes the subject of the image. See Section 8: Baseline Fields.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifTagValue.SubIFDs
member.summary: Offset to child IFDs. See TIFF Supplement 1: Adobe Pagemaker 6.0. Each value is an offset (from the beginning of the TIFF file, as always) to a child IFD. Child images provide extra information for the parent image - such as a subsampled version of the parent image. TIFF data type is Long or 13, IFD. The IFD type is identical to LONG, except that it is only used to point to other valid IFDs.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifTagValue.GlobalParametersIFD
member.summary: Used in the TIFF-FX standard to point to an IFD containing tags that are globally applicable to the complete TIFF file. See RFC2301: TIFF-F/FX Specification. It is recommended that a TIFF writer place this field in the first IFD, where a TIFF reader would find it quickly. Each field in the GlobalParametersIFD is a TIFF field that is legal in any IFD. Required baseline fields should not be located in the GlobalParametersIFD, but should be in each image IFD. If a conflict exists between fields in the GlobalParametersIFD and in the image IFDs, then the data in the image IFD shall prevail.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifTagValue.MDFileTag
member.summary: Specifies the pixel data format encoding in the Molecular Dynamics GEL file format. See Molecular Dynamics GEL File Format and Private Tags: https://www.awaresystems.be/imaging/tiff/tifftags/docs/gel.html

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifTagValue.MDScalePixel
member.summary: Specifies a scale factor in the Molecular Dynamics GEL file format. See Molecular Dynamics GEL File Format and Private Tags: https://www.awaresystems.be/imaging/tiff/tifftags/docs/gel.html The scale factor is to be applies to each pixel before presenting it to the user.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifTagValue.MDColorTable
member.summary: Used to specify the conversion from 16bit to 8bit in the Molecular Dynamics GEL file format. See Molecular Dynamics GEL File Format and Private Tags: https://www.awaresystems.be/imaging/tiff/tifftags/docs/gel.html Since the display is only 9bit, the 16bit data must be converted before display. 8bit value = (16bit value - low range ) * 255 / (high range - low range) Count: n.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifTagValue.MDLabName
member.summary: Name of the lab that scanned this file, as used in the Molecular Dynamics GEL file format. See Molecular Dynamics GEL File Format and Private Tags: https://www.awaresystems.be/imaging/tiff/tifftags/docs/gel.html

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifTagValue.MDSampleInfo
member.summary: Information about the sample, as used in the Molecular Dynamics GEL file format. See Molecular Dynamics GEL File Format and Private Tags: https://www.awaresystems.be/imaging/tiff/tifftags/docs/gel.html This information is entered by the person that scanned the file. Note that the word 'sample' as used here, refers to the scanned sample, not an image channel.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifTagValue.MDPrepDate
member.summary: Date the sample was prepared, as used in the Molecular Dynamics GEL file format. See Molecular Dynamics GEL File Format and Private Tags: https://www.awaresystems.be/imaging/tiff/tifftags/docs/gel.html The format of this data is YY/MM/DD. Note that the word 'sample' as used here, refers to the scanned sample, not an image channel.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifTagValue.MDPrepTime
member.summary: Time the sample was prepared, as used in the Molecular Dynamics GEL file format. See Molecular Dynamics GEL File Format and Private Tags: https://www.awaresystems.be/imaging/tiff/tifftags/docs/gel.html Format of this data is HH:MM using the 24-hour clock. Note that the word 'sample' as used here, refers to the scanned sample, not an image channel.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifTagValue.MDFileUnits
member.summary: Units for data in this file, as used in the Molecular Dynamics GEL file format. See Molecular Dynamics GEL File Format and Private Tags: https://www.awaresystems.be/imaging/tiff/tifftags/docs/gel.html

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifTagValue.IccProfile
member.summary: ICC profile data. See https://www.awaresystems.be/imaging/tiff/tifftags/iccprofile.html

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifTagValue.GeoKeyDirectoryTag
member.summary: Used in interchangeable GeoTIFF files. See https://www.awaresystems.be/imaging/tiff/tifftags/geokeydirectorytag.html This tag is also know as 'ProjectionInfoTag' and 'CoordSystemInfoTag' This tag may be used to store the GeoKey Directory, which defines and references the "GeoKeys".

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifTagValue.GeoDoubleParamsTag
member.summary: Used in interchangeable GeoTIFF files. See https://www.awaresystems.be/imaging/tiff/tifftags/geodoubleparamstag.html This tag is used to store all of the DOUBLE valued GeoKeys, referenced by the GeoKeyDirectoryTag. The meaning of any value of this double array is determined from the GeoKeyDirectoryTag reference pointing to it. FLOAT values should first be converted to DOUBLE and stored here.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifTagValue.GeoAsciiParamsTag
member.summary: Used in interchangeable GeoTIFF files. See https://www.awaresystems.be/imaging/tiff/tifftags/geoasciiparamstag.html This tag is used to store all of the ASCII valued GeoKeys, referenced by the GeoKeyDirectoryTag. Since keys use offsets into tags, any special comments may be placed at the beginning of this tag. For the most part, the only keys that are ASCII valued are "Citation" keys, giving documentation and references for obscure projections, datums, etc.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifTagValue.InteroperabilityIFD
member.summary: A pointer to the Exif-related Interoperability IFD. See https://www.awaresystems.be/imaging/tiff/tifftags/privateifd/interoperability.html Interoperability IFD is composed of tags which stores the information to ensure the Interoperability. The Interoperability structure of Interoperability IFD is same as TIFF defined IFD structure but does not contain the image data characteristically compared with normal TIFF IFD.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifTagValue.OceScanjobDescription
member.summary: Used in the Oce scanning process. Identifies the scanticket used in the scanning process. Includes a trailing zero. See https://www.awaresystems.be/imaging/tiff/tifftags/docs/oce.html

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifTagValue.OceApplicationSelector
member.summary: Used in the Oce scanning process. Identifies the application to process the TIFF file that results from scanning. Includes a trailing zero. See https://www.awaresystems.be/imaging/tiff/tifftags/docs/oce.html

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifTagValue.OceIdentificationNumber
member.summary: Used in the Oce scanning process. This is the user's answer to an optional question embedded in the Oce scanticket, and presented to that user before scanning. It can serve in further determination of the workflow. See https://www.awaresystems.be/imaging/tiff/tifftags/docs/oce.html

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifTagValue.OceImageLogicCharacteristics
member.summary: Used in the Oce scanning process. This tag encodes the imageprocessing done by the Oce ImageLogic module in the scanner to ensure optimal quality for certain workflows. See https://www.awaresystems.be/imaging/tiff/tifftags/docs/oce.html

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Exif.ExifTagValue.AliasLayerMetadata
member.summary: Alias Sketchbook Pro layer usage description. See https://www.awaresystems.be/imaging/tiff/tifftags/docs/alias.html

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccCurveMeasurementEncodings.StatusA
member.summary: ISO 5-3 densitometer response. This is the accepted standard for reflection densitometers for measuring photographic color prints

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccCurveMeasurementEncodings.StatusE
member.summary: ISO 5-3 densitometer response which is the accepted standard in Europe for color reflection densitometers

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccCurveMeasurementEncodings.StatusI
member.summary: ISO 5-3 densitometer response commonly referred to as narrow band or interference-type response.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccCurveMeasurementEncodings.StatusT
member.summary: ISO 5-3 wide band color reflection densitometer response which is the accepted standard in the United States for color reflection densitometers

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccCurveMeasurementEncodings.StatusM
member.summary: ISO 5-3 densitometer response for measuring color negatives

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccCurveMeasurementEncodings.DinE
member.summary: DIN 16536-2 densitometer response, with no polarizing filter

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccCurveMeasurementEncodings.DinEPol
member.summary: DIN 16536-2 densitometer response, with polarizing filter

member.summary: DIN 16536-2 narrow band densitometer response, with no polarizing filter

member.summary: DIN 16536-2 narrow band densitometer response, with polarizing filter

member.summary: Enumerates the basic data types as defined in ICC.1:2010 version 4.3.0.0 Section 4.2 to 4.15

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccDataType.DateTime
member.summary: A 12-byte value representation of the time and date

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccDataType.Float32
member.summary: A single-precision 32-bit floating-point as specified in IEEE 754, excluding un-normalized s, infinities, and not a "" (NaN) values

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccDataType.Position
member.summary: Positions of some data elements are indicated using a position offset with the data element's size.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccDataType.Response16
member.summary: An 8-byte value, used to associate a normalized device code with a measurement value

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccDataType.S15Fixed16
member.summary: A fixed signed 4-byte (32-bit) quantity which has 16 fractional bits

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccDataType.U16Fixed16
member.summary: A fixed unsigned 4-byte (32-bit) quantity having 16 fractional bits

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccDataType.U1Fixed15
member.summary: A fixed unsigned 2-byte (16-bit) quantity having15 fractional bits

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccDataType.U8Fixed8
member.summary: A fixed unsigned 2-byte (16-bit) quantity having 8 fractional bits

member.summary: An unsigned 2-byte (16-bit) integer

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccDataType.UInt32
member.summary: An unsigned 4-byte (32-bit) integer

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccDataType.UInt64
member.summary: An unsigned 8-byte (64-bit) integer

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccDataType.UInt8
member.summary: An unsigned 1-byte (8-bit) integer

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccDataType.Xyz
member.summary: A set of three fixed signed 4-byte (32-bit) quantities used to encode CIEXYZ, nCIEXYZ, and PCSXYZ tristimulus values

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccDataType.Ascii
member.summary: Alpha-numeric values, and other input and output codes, shall conform to the American Standard Code for Information Interchange (ASCII) specified in ISO/IEC 646.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccFormulaCurveType.Type2

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccFormulaCurveType.Type3

member.summary: Set of curves

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccMultiProcessElementSignature.Matrix
member.summary: Matrix transformation

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccMultiProcessElementSignature.Clut
member.summary: Color lookup table

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccMultiProcessElementSignature.BAcs
member.summary: Reserved for future expansion. Do not use!

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccMultiProcessElementSignature.EAcs
member.summary: Reserved for future expansion. Do not use!

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccParametricCurveType
member.summary: Formula curve segment type

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccParametricCurveType.Type1
member.summary: Type 1: Y = X^g

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccParametricCurveType.Cie122_1996
member.summary:
CIE 122-1996:
For X >= -b/a: Y =(a * X + b)^g
For X $lt; -b/a: Y = 0

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccParametricCurveType.Iec61966_3
member.summary:
IEC 61966-3:
For X >= -b/a: Y =(a * X + b)^g + c
For X $lt; -b/a: Y = c

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccParametricCurveType.SRgb
member.summary:
IEC 61966-2-1 (sRGB):
For X >= d: Y =(a * X + b)^g
For X $lt; d: Y = c * X

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccParametricCurveType.Type5
member.summary:
Type 5:
For X >= d: Y =(a * X + b)^g + c
For X $lt; d: Y = c * X + f

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileClass
member.summary: Profile Class Name

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileClass.InputDevice
member.summary: Input profiles are generally used with devices such as scanners and digital cameras. The types of profiles available for use as Input profiles are N-component LUT-based, Three-component matrix-based, and monochrome.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileClass.DisplayDevice
member.summary: This class of profiles represents display devices such as monitors. The types of profiles available for use as Display profiles are N-component LUT-based, Three-component matrix-based, and monochrome.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileClass.OutputDevice
member.summary: Output profiles are used to support devices such as printers and film recorders. The types of profiles available for use as Output profiles are N-component LUT-based and Monochrome.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileClass.DeviceLink
member.summary: This profile contains a pre-evaluated transform that cannot be undone, which represents a one-way link or connection between devices. It does not represent any device model nor can it be embedded into images.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileClass.ColorSpace
member.summary: This profile provides the relevant information to perform a transformation between color encodings and the PCS. This type of profile is based on modeling rather than device measurement or characterization data. ColorSpace profiles may be embedded in images.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileClass.Abstract
member.summary: This profile represents abstract transforms and does not represent any device model. Color transformations using Abstract profiles are performed from PCS to PCS. Abstract profiles cannot be embedded in images.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileClass.NamedColor
member.summary: NamedColor profiles can be thought of as sibling profiles to device profiles. For a given device there would be one or more device profiles to handle process color conversions and one or more named color profiles to handle named colors.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileFlag
member.summary: Profile flags. Can be combined with a logical OR. The least-significant 16 bits are reserved for the ICC, the rest can be used for vendor specific values

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileFlag.None
member.summary: No flags (equivalent to NotEmbedded and Independent)

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileFlag.Embedded
member.summary: Profile is embedded within another file

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileFlag.NotEmbedded
member.summary: Profile is embedded within another file

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag
member.summary:
Enumerates the ICC Profile Tags as defined in ICC.1:2010 version 4.3.0.0 Section 9
Each tag value represent the size of the tag in the profile.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.Unknown
member.summary: Unknown tag

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.AToB0
member.summary: A2B0 - This tag defines a color transform from Device, Color Encoding or PCS, to PCS, or a color transform from Device 1 to Device 2, using lookup table tag element structures

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.AToB1
member.summary: A2B2 - This tag describes the color transform from Device or Color Encoding to PCS using lookup table tag element structures

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.AToB2
member.summary: A2B2 - This tag describes the color transform from Device or Color Encoding to PCS using lookup table tag element structures

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.BlueMatrixColumn
member.summary: bXYZ - This tag contains the third column in the matrix used in matrix/TRC transforms.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.BlueTrc
member.summary: bTRC - This tag contains the blue channel tone reproduction curve. The first element represents no colorant (white) or phosphor (black) and the last element represents 100 % colorant (blue) or 100 % phosphor (blue).

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.BToA0
member.summary: B2A0 - This tag defines a color transform from PCS to Device or Color Encoding using the lookup table tag element structures

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.BToA1
member.summary: B2A1 - This tag defines a color transform from PCS to Device or Color Encoding using the lookup table tag element structures.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.BToA2
member.summary: B2A2 - This tag defines a color transform from PCS to Device or Color Encoding using the lookup table tag element structures.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.BToD0
member.summary: B2D0 - This tag defines a color transform from PCS to Device. It supports float32Number-encoded input range, output range and transform, and provides a means to override the BToA0 tag.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.BToD1
member.summary: B2D1 - This tag defines a color transform from PCS to Device. It supports float32Number-encoded input range, output range and transform, and provides a means to override the BToA1 tag.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.BToD2
member.summary: B2D2 - This tag defines a color transform from PCS to Device. It supports float32Number-encoded input range, output range and transform, and provides a means to override the BToA2 tag.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.BToD3
member.summary: B2D3 - This tag defines a color transform from PCS to Device. It supports float32Number-encoded input range, output range and transform, and provides a means to override the BToA1 tag.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.CalibrationDateTime
member.summary: calt - This tag contains the profile calibration date and time. This allows applications and utilities to verify if this profile matches a vendor's profile and how recently calibration has been performed.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.CharTarget
member.summary: targ - This tag contains the name of the registered characterization data set, or it contains the measurement data for a characterization target.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.ChromaticAdaptation
member.summary: chad - This tag contains a matrix, which shall be invertible, and which converts an nCIEXYZ color, measured using the actual illumination conditions and relative to the actual adopted white, to an nCIEXYZ color relative to the PCS adopted white

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.Chromaticity
member.summary: chrm - This tag contains the type and the data of the phosphor/colorant chromaticity set used.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.ColorantOrder
member.summary: clro - This tag specifies the laydown order of colorants.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.ColorantTable
member.summary: clrt

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.ColorantTableOut
member.summary: clot - This tag identifies the colorants used in the profile by a unique name and set of PCSXYZ or PCSLAB values. When used in DeviceLink profiles only the PCSLAB values shall be permitted.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.ColorimetricIntentImageStat
member.summary: ciis - This tag indicates the image state of PCS colorimetry produced using the colorimetric intent transforms.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.Copyright
member.summary: cprt - This tag contains the text copyright information for the profile.

member.summary: crdi - Removed in V4

member.summary: dmnd - This tag describes the structure containing invariant and localizable versions of the device manufacturer for display

member.summary: dmdd - This tag describes the structure containing invariant and localizable versions of the device model for display.

member.summary: devs - Removed in V4

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.DToB0
member.summary: D2B0 - This tag defines a color transform from Device to PCS. It supports float32Number-encoded input range, output range and transform, and provides a means to override the AToB0 tag

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.DToB1
member.summary: D2B1 - This tag defines a color transform from Device to PCS. It supports float32Number-encoded input range, output range and transform, and provides a means to override the AToB1 tag

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.DToB2
member.summary: D2B2 - This tag defines a color transform from Device to PCS. It supports float32Number-encoded input range, output range and transform, and provides a means to override the AToB1 tag

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.DToB3
member.summary: D2B3 - This tag defines a color transform from Device to PCS. It supports float32Number-encoded input range, output range and transform, and provides a means to override the AToB1 tag

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.Gamut
member.summary: gamt - This tag provides a table in which PCS values are the input and a single output value for each input value is the output. If the output value is 0, the PCS color is in-gamut. If the output is non-zero, the PCS color is out-of-gamut

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.GrayTrc
member.summary: kTRC - This tag contains the grey tone reproduction curve. The tone reproduction curve provides the necessary information to convert between a single device channel and the PCSXYZ or PCSLAB encoding.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.GreenMatrixColumn
member.summary: gXYZ - This tag contains the second column in the matrix, which is used in matrix/TRC transforms.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.GreenTrc
member.summary: gTRC - This tag contains the green channel tone reproduction curve. The first element represents no colorant (white) or phosphor (black) and the last element represents 100 % colorant (green) or 100 % phosphor (green).

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.Luminance
member.summary: lumi - This tag contains the absolute luminance of emissive devices in candelas per square meter as described by the Y channel.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.Measurement
member.summary: meas - This tag describes the alternative measurement specification, such as a D65 illuminant instead of the default D50.

member.summary: bkpt - Removed in V4

member.summary: wtpt - This tag, which is used for generating the ICC-absolute colorimetric intent, specifies the chromatically adapted nCIEXYZ tristimulus values of the media white point.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.NamedColor
member.summary: ncol - OBSOLETE, use

member.summary: ncl2 - This tag contains the named color information providing a PCS and optional device representation for a list of named colors.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccRenderingIntent
member.summary: Rendering intent

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccRenderingIntent.Perceptual
member.summary: In perceptual transforms the PCS values represent hypothetical measurements of a color reproduction on the reference reflective medium. By extension, for the perceptual intent, the PCS represents the appearance of that reproduction as viewed in the reference viewing environment by a human observer adapted to that environment. The exact color rendering of the perceptual intent is vendor specific.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccRenderingIntent.MediaRelativeColorimetric
member.summary: Transformations for this intent shall re-scale the in-gamut, chromatically adapted tristimulus values such that the white point of the actual medium is mapped to the PCS white point (for either input or output)

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccRenderingIntent.Saturation
member.summary: The exact color rendering of the saturation intent is vendor specific and involves compromises such as trading off preservation of hue in order to preserve the vividness of pure colors.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccRenderingIntent.AbsoluteColorimetric
member.summary: Transformations for this intent shall leave the chromatically adapted nCIEXYZ tristimulus values of the in-gamut colors unchanged.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature
member.summary: Type Signature

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.Unknown
member.summary: Unknown type signature

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.Chromaticity
member.summary: The chromaticity tag type provides basic chromaticity data and type of phosphors or colorants of a monitor to applications and utilities

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.ColorantOrder
member.summary: This is an optional tag which specifies the laydown order in which colorants will be printed on an n-colorant device. The laydown order may be the same as the channel generation order listed in the colorantTableTag or the channel order of a color encoding type such as CMYK, in which case this tag is not needed. When this is not the case (for example, ink-towers sometimes use the order KCMY), this tag may be used to specify the laydown order of the colorants

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.ColorantTable
member.summary: The purpose of this tag is to identify the colorants used in the profile by a unique name and set of PCSXYZ or PCSLAB values to give the colorant an unambiguous value. The first colorant listed is the colorant of the first device channel of a LUT tag. The second colorant listed is the colorant of the second device channel of a LUT tag, and so on

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.Curve
member.summary: The curveType embodies a one-dimensional function which maps an input value in the domain of the function to an output value in the range of the function

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.Data
member.summary: The dataType is a simple data structure that contains either 7-bit ASCII or binary data

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.DateTime
member.summary: Date and time defined by 6 unsigned 16bit integers (year, month, day, hour, minute, second)

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.Lut16
member.summary: This structure represents a color transform using tables with 16-bit precision. This type contains four processing elements: a 3 × 3 matrix (which shall be the identity matrix unless the input color space is PCSXYZ), a set of one-dimensional input tables, a multi-dimensional lookup table, and a set of one-dimensional output tables

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.Lut8
member.summary: This structure represents a color transform using tables of 8-bit precision. This type contains four processing elements: a 3 × 3 matrix (which shall be the identity matrix unless the input color space is PCSXYZ), a set of one-dimensional input tables, a multi-dimensional lookup table, and a set of one-dimensional output tables.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.LutAToB
member.summary: This structure represents a color transform. The type contains up to five processing elements which are stored in the AToBTag tag in the following order: a set of one-dimensional curves, a 3 × 3 matrix with offset terms, a set of one-dimensional curves, a multi-dimensional lookup table, and a set of one-dimensional output curves

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.LutBToA
member.summary: This structure represents a color transform. The type contains up to five processing elements which are stored in the BToATag in the following order: a set of one-dimensional curves, a 3 × 3 matrix with offset terms, a set of one-dimensional curves, a multi-dimensional lookup table, and a set of one-dimensional curves.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.Measurement
member.summary: This information refers only to the internal profile data and is meant to provide profile makers an alternative to the default measurement specifications

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.MultiLocalizedUnicode
member.summary: This tag structure contains a set of records each referencing a multilingual Unicode string associated with a profile. Each string is referenced in a separate record with the information about what language and region the string is for.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.MultiProcessElements
member.summary: This structure represents a color transform, containing a sequence of processing elements. The processing elements contained in the structure are defined in the structure itself, allowing for a flexible structure. Currently supported processing elements are: a set of one dimensional curves, a matrix with offset terms, and a multidimensional lookup table (CLUT). Other processing element types may be added in the future. Each type of processing element may be contained any number of times in the structure.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.NamedColor2
member.summary: This type is a count value and array of structures that provide color coordinates for color names. For each named color, a PCS and optional device representation of the color are given. Both representations are 16-bit values and PCS values shall be relative colorimetric. The device representation corresponds to the header’s "data color space" field. This representation should be consistent with the "number of device coordinates" field in the namedColor2Type. If this field is 0, device coordinates are not provided. The PCS representation corresponds to the header's PCS field. The PCS representation is always provided. Color names are fixed-length, 32-byte fields including null termination. In order to maintain maximum portability, it is strongly recommended that special characters of the 7-bit ASCII set not be used.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.ParametricCurve
member.summary: This type describes a one-dimensional curve by specifying one of a predefined set of functions using the parameters.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.ProfileSequenceDesc
member.summary: This type is an array of structures, each of which contains information from the header fields and tags from the original profiles which were combined to create the final profile. The order of the structures is the order in which the profiles were combined and includes a structure for the final profile. This provides a description of the profile sequence from source to destination, typically used with the DeviceLink profile.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.ProfileSequenceIdentifier
member.summary: This type is an array of structures, each of which contains information for identification of a profile used in a sequence.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.ResponseCurveSet16
member.summary: The purpose of this tag type is to provide a mechanism to relate physical colorant amounts with the normalized device codes produced by lut8Type, lut16Type, lutAToBType, lutBToAType or multiProcessElementsType tags so that corrections can be made for variation in the device without having to produce a new profile. The mechanism can be used by applications to allow users with relatively inexpensive and readily available instrumentation to apply corrections to individual output color channels in order to achieve consistent results.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.S15Fixed16Array
member.summary: Array of signed floating point numbers with 1 sign bit, 15 value bits and 16 fractional bits

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.Signature
member.summary: The signatureType contains a 4-byte sequence. Sequences of less than four characters are padded at the end with spaces. Typically this type is used for registered tags that can be displayed on many development systems as a sequence of four characters.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.Text
member.summary: Simple ASCII text

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.U16Fixed16Array
member.summary: Array of unsigned floating point numbers with 16 value bits and 16 fractional bits

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.UInt16Array
member.summary: Array of unsigned 16bit integers (ushort)

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.UInt32Array
member.summary: Array of unsigned 32bit integers (uint)

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.UInt64Array
member.summary: Array of unsigned 64bit integers (ulong)

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.UInt8Array
member.summary: Array of unsigned 8bit integers (byte)

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.ViewingConditions
member.summary: This type represents a set of viewing condition parameters.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.Xyz
member.summary: 3 floating point values describing a XYZ color value

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.TextDescription
member.summary: REMOVED IN V4 - The textDescriptionType is a complex structure that contains three types of text description structures: 7-bit ASCII, Unicode and ScriptCode. Since no single standard method for specifying localizable character sets exists across the major platform vendors, including all three provides access for the major operating systems. The 7-bit ASCII description is to be an invariant, nonlocalizable name for consistent reference. It is preferred that both the Unicode and ScriptCode structures be properly localized.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.CrdInfo
member.summary: REMOVED IN V4 - This type contains the PostScript product name to which this profile corresponds and the names of the companion CRDs

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.Screening
member.summary: REMOVED IN V4 - The screeningType describes various screening parameters including screen frequency, screening angle, and spot shape

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.UcrBg
member.summary: REMOVED IN V4 - This type contains curves representing the under color removal and black generation and a text string which is a general description of the method used for the UCR and BG

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.DeviceSettings
member.summary: REMOVED IN V4 - This type is an array of structures each of which contains platform-specific information about the settings of the device for which this profile is valid. This type is not supported.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.NamedColor
member.summary: REMOVED IN V2 - use instead. This type is not supported.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Iptc.IptcProfile.SetDateTimeValue(SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Iptc.IptcTag,System.DateTimeOffset)
member.summary:
Makes sure the datetime is formatted according to the iptc specification.
A date will be formatted as CCYYMMDD, e.g. "19890317" for 17 March 1989. A time value will be formatted as HHMMSS±HHMM, e.g. "090000+0200" for 9 o'clock Berlin time, two hours ahead of UTC.
member.param: The tag of the iptc value.

member.param: The tag of the iptc value.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Iptc.IptcTag.ReleaseDate
member.summary:
Release date. Format should be CCYYMMDD. Not repeatable, max length is 8.
A date will be formatted as CCYYMMDD, e.g. "19890317" for 17 March 1989.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Iptc.IptcTag.ReleaseTime
member.summary:
Release time. Format should be HHMMSS±HHMM. Not repeatable, max length is 11.
A time value will be formatted as HHMMSS±HHMM, e.g. "090000+0200" for 9 o'clock Berlin time, two hours ahead of UTC.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.IPixel`1
member.summary: An interface that represents a generic pixel type. The naming convention of each pixel format is to order the color components from least significant to most significant, reading from left to right. For example in the pixel format the R component is the least significant byte, and the A component is the most significant.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelAlphaRepresentation
member.summary: Provides enumeration of the alpha value transparency behavior of a pixel format.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelAlphaRepresentation.None
member.summary: Indicates that the pixel format does not contain an alpha channel.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelAlphaRepresentation.Associated
member.summary: Indicates that the transparency behavior is premultiplied. Each color is first scaled by the alpha value. The alpha value itself is the same in both straight and premultiplied alpha. Typically, no color channel value is greater than the alpha channel value. If a color channel value in a premultiplied format is greater than the alpha channel, the standard source-over blending math results in an additive blend.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelAlphaRepresentation.Unassociated
member.summary: Indicates that the transparency behavior is not premultiplied. The alpha channel indicates the transparency of the color.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelBlenders.DefaultPixelBlenders`1
member.summary: Collection of Porter Duff alpha blending functions applying different composition models.
member.remarks: These functions are designed to be a general solution for all color cases, that is, they take in account the alpha value of both the backdrop and source, and there's no need to alpha-premultiply neither the backdrop nor the source. Note there are faster functions for when the backdrop color is known to be opaque

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelBlenders.PorterDuffFunctions
member.summary: Collection of Porter Duff Color Blending and Alpha Composition Functions.
member.remarks: These functions are designed to be a general solution for all color cases, that is, they take in account the alpha value of both the backdrop and source, and there's no need to alpha-premultiply neither the backdrop nor the source. Note there are faster functions for when the backdrop color is known to be opaque

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelColorBlendingMode
member.summary: Enumerates the various color blending modes.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelColorBlendingMode.Normal
member.summary: Default blending mode, also known as "Normal" or "Alpha Blending"

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelColorBlendingMode.Multiply
member.summary: Blends the 2 values by multiplication.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelColorBlendingMode.Add
member.summary: Blends the 2 values by addition.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelColorBlendingMode.Subtract
member.summary: Blends the 2 values by subtraction.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelColorBlendingMode.Screen
member.summary: Multiplies the complements of the backdrop and source values, then complements the result.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelColorBlendingMode.Darken
member.summary: Selects the minimum of the backdrop and source values.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelColorBlendingMode.Lighten
member.summary: Selects the max of the backdrop and source values.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelColorBlendingMode.Overlay
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the values, depending on the backdrop vector values.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelColorBlendingMode.HardLight
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the source value.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.A8
member.summary:

Ranges from [0, 0, 0, 0] to [0, 0, 0, 1] in vector form.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.Abgr32
member.summary:
Packed pixel type containing four 8-bit unsigned normalized values ranging from 0 to 255. The color components are stored in alpha, red, green, and blue order (least significant to most significant byte).
Ranges from [0, 0, 0, 0] to [1, 1, 1, 1] in vector form.
member.remarks: This struct is fully mutable. This is done (against the guidelines) for the sake of performance, as it avoids the need to create new values for modification operations.
member.content: Provides optimized overrides for bulk operations.
Provides optimized overrides for bulk operations.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.Utils.PixelConverter
member.summary: Contains optimized implementations for conversion between pixel formats.
member.remarks: Implementations are based on ideas in: https://github.com/dotnet/coreclr/blob/master/src/System.Private.CoreLib/shared/System/Buffers/Binary/Reader.cs#L84 The JIT can detect and optimize rotation idioms ROTL (Rotate Left) and ROTR (Rotate Right) emitting efficient CPU instructions: https://github.com/dotnet/coreclr/pull/1830

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.BrightnessExtensions
member.summary: Defines extensions that allow the alteration of the brightness component of an using Mutate/Clone.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.BrightnessExtensions.Brightness(SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.IImageProcessingContext,System.Single)
member.summary: Alters the brightness component of the image.
member.remarks: A value of 0 will create an image that is completely black. A value of 1 leaves the input unchanged. Other values are linear multipliers on the effect. Values of an amount over 1 are allowed, providing brighter results.
member.param: The proportion of the conversion. Must be greater than or equal to 0.
member.returns: The to allow chaining of operations.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownFilterMatrices.CreateBrightnessFilter(System.Single)
member.summary: Create a brightness filter matrix using the given amount.
member.remarks: A value of 0 will create an image that is completely black. A value of 1 leaves the input unchanged. Other values are linear multipliers on the effect. Values of an amount over 1 are allowed, providing brighter results.
member.param: The proportion of the conversion. Must be greater than or equal to 0.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownFilterMatrices.CreateContrastFilter(System.Single)
member.summary: Create a contrast filter matrix using the given amount.
member.remarks: A value of 0 will create an image that is completely gray. A value of 1 leaves the input unchanged. Other values are linear multipliers on the effect. Values of an amount over 1 are allowed, providing results with more contrast.
member.param: The proportion of the conversion. Must be greater than or equal to 0.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownFilterMatrices.CreateGrayscaleBt601Filter(System.Single)
member.summary: Create a grayscale filter matrix using the given amount using the formula as specified by ITU-R Recommendation BT.601.
member.param: The proportion of the conversion. Must be between 0 and 1.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownFilterMatrices.CreateGrayscaleBt709Filter(System.Single)
member.summary: Create a grayscale filter matrix using the given amount using the formula as specified by ITU-R Recommendation BT.709.
member.param: The proportion of the conversion. Must be between 0 and 1.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownFilterMatrices.CreateHueFilter(System.Single)
member.summary: Create a hue filter matrix using the given angle in degrees.
member.param: The angle of rotation in degrees.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownFilterMatrices.CreateInvertFilter(System.Single)
member.summary: Create an invert filter matrix using the given amount.
member.param: The proportion of the conversion. Must be between 0 and 1.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownFilterMatrices.CreateOpacityFilter(System.Single)
member.summary: Create an opacity filter matrix using the given amount.
member.param: The proportion of the conversion. Must be between 0 and 1.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownFilterMatrices.CreateSaturateFilter(System.Single)
member.summary: Create a saturation filter matrix using the given amount.
member.remarks: A value of 0 is completely un-saturated. A value of 1 leaves the input unchanged. Other values are linear multipliers on the effect. Values of amount over 1 are allowed, providing super-saturated results
member.param: The proportion of the conversion. Must be greater than or equal to 0.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownFilterMatrices.CreateLightnessFilter(System.Single)
member.summary: Create a lightness filter matrix using the given amount.
member.remarks: A value of 0 will create an image that is completely black. A value of 1 leaves the input unchanged. Other values are linear multipliers on the effect. Values of an amount over 1 are allowed, providing lighter results.
member.param: The proportion of the conversion. Must be greater than or equal to 0.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownFilterMatrices.CreateSepiaFilter(System.Single)
member.summary: Create a sepia filter matrix using the given amount. The formula used matches the svg specification.
member.param: The proportion of the conversion. Must be between 0 and 1.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownQuantizers
member.summary: Contains reusable static instances of known quantizing algorithms

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownQuantizers.Octree
member.summary: Gets the adaptive Octree quantizer. Fast with good quality.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownQuantizers.Wu
member.summary: Gets the Xiaolin Wu's Color Quantizer which generates high quality output.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownQuantizers.WebSafe
member.summary: Gets the palette based quantizer consisting of web safe colors as defined in the CSS Color Module Level 4.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownQuantizers.Werner
member.summary: Gets the palette based quantizer consisting of colors as defined in the original second edition of Werner’s Nomenclature of Colours 1821. The hex codes were collected and defined by Nicholas Rougeux

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownResamplers
member.summary: Contains reusable static instances of known resampling algorithms

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownResamplers.Bicubic
member.summary: Gets the Bicubic sampler that implements the bicubic kernel algorithm W(x)

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownResamplers.Box
member.summary: Gets the Box sampler that implements the box algorithm. Similar to nearest neighbor when upscaling. When downscaling the pixels will average, merging pixels together.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownResamplers.CatmullRom
member.summary: Gets the Catmull-Rom sampler, a well known standard Cubic Filter often used as a interpolation function

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownResamplers.Hermite
member.summary: Gets the Hermite sampler. A type of smoothed triangular interpolation filter that rounds off strong edges while preserving flat 'color levels' in the original image.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownResamplers.Lanczos2
member.summary: Gets the Lanczos kernel sampler that implements smooth interpolation with a radius of 2 pixels. This algorithm provides sharpened results when compared to others when downsampling.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownResamplers.Lanczos3
member.summary: Gets the Lanczos kernel sampler that implements smooth interpolation with a radius of 3 pixels This algorithm provides sharpened results when compared to others when downsampling.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownResamplers.Lanczos5
member.summary: Gets the Lanczos kernel sampler that implements smooth interpolation with a radius of 5 pixels This algorithm provides sharpened results when compared to others when downsampling.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownResamplers.Lanczos8
member.summary: Gets the Lanczos kernel sampler that implements smooth interpolation with a radius of 8 pixels This algorithm provides sharpened results when compared to others when downsampling.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownResamplers.MitchellNetravali
member.summary: Gets the Mitchell-Netravali sampler. This seperable cubic algorithm yields a very good equilibrium between detail preservation (sharpness) and smoothness.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownResamplers.NearestNeighbor
member.summary: Gets the Nearest-Neighbour sampler that implements the nearest neighbor algorithm. This uses a very fast, unscaled filter which will select the closest pixel to the new pixels position.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownResamplers.Robidoux
member.summary: Gets the Robidoux sampler. This algorithm developed by Nicolas Robidoux providing a very good equilibrium between detail preservation (sharpness) and smoothness comparable to .

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownResamplers.RobidouxSharp
member.summary: Gets the Robidoux Sharp sampler. A sharpened form of the sampler

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownResamplers.Spline
member.summary: Gets the Spline sampler. A separable cubic algorithm similar to but yielding smoother results.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownResamplers.Triangle
member.summary: Gets the Triangle sampler, otherwise known as Bilinear. This interpolation algorithm can be used where perfect image transformation with pixel matching is impossible, so that one can calculate and assign appropriate intensity values to pixels

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownResamplers.Welch
member.summary: Gets the Welch sampler. A high speed algorithm that delivers very sharpened results.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.Processors.Convolution.BokehBlurProcessor.SecondPassConvolutionRowOperation
member.summary: A implementing the horizontal convolution logic for .
member.remarks: This type is located in the non-generic class and not in , where it is actually used, because it does not use any generic parameters internally. Defining in a non-generic class means that there will only ever be a single instantiation of this type for the JIT/AOT compilers to process, instead of having duplicate versions for each pixel type.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.Processors.Normalization.AdaptiveHistogramEqualizationProcessor
member.summary: Applies an adaptive histogram equalization to the image. The image is split up in tiles. For each tile a cumulative distribution function (cdf) is calculated. To calculate the final equalized pixel value, the cdf value of four adjacent tiles will be interpolated.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.Processors.Normalization.AdaptiveHistogramEqualizationProcessor.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The number of different luminance levels. Typical values are 256 for 8-bit grayscale images or 65536 for 16-bit grayscale images.
Indicating whether to clip the histogram bins at a specific value.
The histogram clip limit. Histogram bins which exceed this limit, will be capped at this value.
The number of tiles the image is split into (horizontal and vertically). Minimum value is 2. Maximum value is 100.

member.summary: Applies the sliding window equalization to one column of the image. The window is moved from top to bottom. Moving the window one pixel down requires to remove one row from the top of the window from the histogram and adding a new row at the bottom.
Initializes a new instance of the struct.
member.param: if set to true the borders of the image will not be checked.

member.summary: A global histogram equalization.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.Processors.Normalization.HistogramEqualizationMethod.AdaptiveTileInterpolation
member.summary: Adaptive histogram equalization using a tile interpolation approach.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.Processors.Normalization.HistogramEqualizationMethod.AdaptiveSlidingWindow
member.summary: Adaptive histogram equalization using sliding window. Slower then the tile interpolation mode, but can yield to better results.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.Processors.Normalization.HistogramEqualizationOptions
member.summary: Data container providing the different options for the histogram equalization.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.Processors.Normalization.HistogramEqualizationOptions.Method
member.summary: Gets or sets the histogram equalization method to use. Defaults to global histogram equalization.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.Processors.Normalization.HistogramEqualizationOptions.LuminanceLevels
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of different luminance levels. Typical values are 256 for 8-bit grayscale images or 65536 for 16-bit grayscale images. Defaults to 256.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.Processors.Normalization.HistogramEqualizationOptions.ClipHistogram
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to clip the histogram bins at a specific value. It is recommended to use clipping when the AdaptiveTileInterpolation method is used, to suppress artifacts which can occur on the borders of the tiles. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.Processors.Normalization.HistogramEqualizationOptions.ClipLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the histogram clip limit. Adaptive histogram equalization may cause noise to be amplified in near constant regions. To reduce this problem, histogram bins which exceed a given limit will be capped at this value. The exceeding values will be redistributed equally to all other bins. The clipLimit depends on the size of the tiles the image is split into and therefore the image size itself. Defaults to 350.
member.remarks: For more information, see also: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adaptive_histogram_equalization#Contrast_Limited_AHE

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.Processors.Normalization.HistogramEqualizationOptions.NumberOfTiles
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of tiles the image is split into (horizontal and vertically) for the adaptive histogram equalization. Defaults to 8.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.Processors.Normalization.HistogramEqualizationProcessor`1.ClipHistogram(System.Span{System.Int32},System.Int32)
member.summary: AHE tends to over amplify the contrast in near-constant regions of the image, since the histogram in such regions is highly concentrated. Clipping the histogram is meant to reduce this effect, by cutting of histogram bin's which exceed a certain amount and redistribute the values over the clip limit to all other bins equally.
member.param: The histogram to apply the clipping.
Histogram clip limit. Histogram bins which exceed this limit, will be capped at this value.
