member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.Processors.Quantization.WuQuantizer`1
member.summary: An implementation of Wu's color quantizer with alpha channel.

remarks.para: Based on C Implementation of Xiaolin Wu's Color Quantizer (v. 2) (see Graphics Gems volume II, pages 126-133) ().
This adaptation is based on the excellent JeremyAnsel.ColorQuant by Jérémy Ansel

Algorithm: Greedy orthogonal bipartition of RGB space for variance minimization aided by inclusion-exclusion tricks. For speed no nearest neighbor search is done. Slightly better performance can be expected by more sophisticated but more expensive versions.

member.summary: Converts the histogram into moments so that we can rapidly calculate the sums of the above quantities over any desired box.
member.param: The memory allocator used for allocating buffers.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.Processors.Quantization.WuQuantizer`1.Variance(SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.Processors.Quantization.WuQuantizer{`0}.Box@)
member.summary: Computes the weighted variance of a box cube.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.Processors.Quantization.WuQuantizer`1.Maximize(SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.Processors.Quantization.WuQuantizer{`0}.Box@,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@,SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.Processors.Quantization.WuQuantizer{`0}.Moment)
member.summary: We want to minimize the sum of the variances of two sub-boxes. The sum(c^2) terms can be ignored since their sum over both sub-boxes is the same (the sum for the whole box) no matter where we split. The remaining terms have a minus sign in the variance formula, so we drop the minus sign and maximize the sum of the two terms.

member.summary: Cuts a box.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.Processors.Transforms.BicubicResampler
member.summary: The function implements the bicubic kernel algorithm W(x) as described on Wikipedia A commonly used algorithm within image processing that preserves sharpness better than triangle interpolation.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.Processors.Transforms.BoxResampler
member.summary: The function implements the box algorithm. Similar to nearest neighbor when upscaling. When downscaling the pixels will average, merging together.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.Processors.Transforms.CubicResampler
member.summary: Cubic filters contain a collection of different filters of varying B-Spline and Cardinal values. With these two values you can generate any smoothly fitting (continuious first derivative) piece-wise cubic filter.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.Processors.Transforms.CubicResampler.CatmullRom
member.summary: The Catmull-Rom filter is a well known standard Cubic Filter often used as a interpolation function. This filter produces a reasonably sharp edge, but without a the pronounced gradient change on large scale image enlargements that a 'Lagrange' filter can produce.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.Processors.Transforms.CubicResampler.Hermite
member.summary: The Hermite filter is type of smoothed triangular interpolation Filter, This filter rounds off strong edges while preserving flat 'color levels' in the original image.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.Processors.Transforms.CubicResampler.MitchellNetravali
member.summary: The function implements the Mitchell-Netravali algorithm as described on Wikipedia

member.summary: The function implements the Robidoux algorithm.

member.summary: The function implements the Robidoux Sharp algorithm.

member.summary: The function implements the spline algorithm.

member.summary: The function implements the nearest neighbor algorithm. This uses an unscaled filter which will select the closest pixel to the new pixels position.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.Processors.Transforms.TriangleResampler
member.summary: The function implements the triangle (bilinear) algorithm. Bilinear interpolation can be used where perfect image transformation with pixel matching is impossible, so that one can calculate and assign appropriate intensity values to pixels.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.Processors.Transforms.ResizeWorker`1
member.summary: Implements the resize algorithm using a sliding window of size maximized by . The height of the window is a multiple of the vertical kernel's maximum diameter. When sliding the window, the contents of the bottom window band are copied to the new top band. For more details, and visual explanation, see "ResizeWorker.pptx".

member.summary: Pads the resized image to fit the bounds of its container. If only one dimension is passed, will maintain the original aspect ratio.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.ResizeMode.BoxPad
member.summary: Pads the image to fit the bound of the container without resizing the original source. When downscaling, performs the same functionality as

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.ResizeMode.Max
member.summary: Constrains the resized image to fit the bounds of its container maintaining the original aspect ratio.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.ResizeMode.Min
member.summary: Resizes the image until the shortest side reaches the set given dimension. Upscaling is disabled in this mode and the original image will be returned if attempted.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.ResizeMode.Stretch
member.summary: Stretches the resized image to fit the bounds of its container.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.ResizeMode.Manual
member.summary: The target location and size of the resized image has been manually set.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.ResizeOptions
member.summary: The resize options for resizing images against certain modes.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.ResizeOptions.Mode
member.summary: Gets or sets the resize mode.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.ResizeOptions.Position
member.summary: Gets or sets the anchor position.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.ResizeOptions.CenterCoordinates
member.summary: Gets or sets the center coordinates.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.ResizeOptions.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets the target size.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.ResizeOptions.Sampler
member.summary: Gets or sets the sampler to perform the resize operation.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.ResizeOptions.Compand
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to compress or expand individual pixel colors the value on processing.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.ResizeOptions.TargetRectangle
member.summary: Gets or sets the target rectangle to resize into.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.ResizeOptions.PremultiplyAlpha
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to premultiply the alpha (if it exists) during the resize operation.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.ResizeOptions.PadColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color to use as a background when padding an image.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.RotateMode
member.summary: Provides enumeration over how the image should be rotated.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.RotateMode.None
member.summary: Do not rotate the image.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.RotateMode.Rotate90
member.summary: Rotate the image by 90 degrees clockwise.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.RotateMode.Rotate180
member.summary: Rotate the image by 180 degrees clockwise.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.RotateMode.Rotate270
member.summary: Rotate the image by 270 degrees clockwise.

member.summary: Taper the left or top corner

member.name: T:System.MathF
member.summary: Provides single-precision floating point constants and static methods for trigonometric, logarithmic, and other common mathematical functions.
member.remarks: MathF emulation on platforms that don't support it natively.

member.name: F:System.MathF.PI
member.summary: Represents the ratio of the circumference of a circle to its diameter, specified by the constant, π.

member.name: M:System.MathF.Abs(System.Single)
member.summary: Returns the absolute value of a single-precision floating-point number.
member.param: A number that is greater than or equal to , but less than or equal to .
member.returns: A single-precision floating-point number, x, such that 0 ≤ x ≤.

member.name: M:System.MathF.Atan2(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Returns the angle whose tangent is the quotient of two specified numbers.
member.param: The y coordinate of a point.
The x coordinate of a point.
member.returns: An angle, θ, measured in radians, such that -π≤θ≤π, and tan(θ) = y / x, where (x, y) is a point in the Cartesian plane. Observe the following: For (x, y) in quadrant 1, 0 < θ < π/2.For (x, y) in quadrant 2, π/2 < θ≤π.For (x, y) in quadrant 3, -π < θ < -π/2.For (x, y) in quadrant 4, -π/2 < θ < 0.For points on the boundaries of the quadrants, the return value is the following:If y is 0 and x is not negative, θ = 0.If y is 0 and x is negative, θ = π.If y is positive and x is 0, θ = π/2.If y is negative and x is 0, θ = -π/2.If y is 0 and x is 0, θ = 0. If x or y is , or if x and y are either or , the method returns .

member.summary: Returns the smallest integral value that is greater than or equal to the specified single-precision floating-point number.
member.returns: The smallest integral value that is greater than or equal to . If is equal to , , or , that value is returned. Note that this method returns a instead of an integral type.

member.param: A single-precision floating-point number to be rounded.

Specification for how to round if it is midway between two other numbers.
